original: Another week just flew by me. I drove by the new house yesterday and the front window was covered in boxes. We may get the keys at closing, i am getting so excited. If all goes well this week, we will be set for closing a week from wednesday. I was up until after 3:00am last night watching movies with bethany. There has been a lot of movie watching going on around here lately. Here's my rundown; last night we watched thirteen, a movie every mother of a teen should see. It was better then i expected. Then we watched gigli, yeah it was just as bad as the media said it was, but we had to see for ourselves.
polished: Last week flew by me, and I had the opportunity to drive by the new house yesterday. The front window was covered in boxes, which was an exciting sight. We are eagerly anticipating the possibility of receiving the keys at the closing, and I am getting increasingly excited about the prospect of moving in. If everything goes according to plan, we will be able to close on the property by Wednesday of this week. I was up until 3 00 a.m. last night, engrossed in a movie marathon with Bethany. There has been a notable surge in movie nights around here lately. Here's a rundown of the films we've watched  last night, we saw thirteen, a movie that every mother of a teenager should see. It exceeded my expectations, and I would highly recommend it. Then, we watched Gigli, which lived up to its reputation as a cinematic disappointment. Yes, it was just as bad as the media had suggested, but we felt compelled to see it for ourselves.

Hairstylist jonothan antin wants build a second location to his incredibly popular west hollywood salon but this time in beverly hills. Normally no one would care, certainly not i, but as i was flipping thru the channels i caught a glipse of jonothan, equally narcissistic and dull looking at a empty space on rodeo dr speak (in a public voice) 'i am going to build here the greatest salon in the history of the world ever!' and i was hooked. One such program is a reality TV series that defies convention with a concept so bold, it's almost astonishing. Initially, I wouldn't have given it a second thought, but while channel surfing, I stumbled upon an intriguing scene. Jonathan, exuding an air of narcissism and monotony, stood in an empty space on Rodeo Drive, proclaiming in a loud, public voice, 'I am going to create the greatest salon the world has ever seen!' My curiosity was piqued, and I was hooked. It's been a while since I've found a character as captivating as Jonathan, with his absurd

original: What a week ... My right shoulder has tendonitus. It's right under my shoulder blade. So, when i move my arm too much, mainly with a mouse on a computer .... It kills me. I can't move it much now because i was on a spree updating my website and working on other online things. I can barely get up strength to draw anything. Lack of sleep adds to my pain. I'm not too happy right now, but i'll get better. My mom's surgery went ok. Her eyesight has come back some. She can see fuzzy shapes and make out colors. Other than that she's still blind as all sin. Hopefully she'll fully regain her vision soon.
polished: My shoulder has been afflicted with tendonitis, specifically the right one, which is located beneath my shoulder blade. The constant strain of moving my arm, particularly when I'm using a mouse on a computer for extended periods, has been exacerbating the condition. The pain is quite debilitating, making it challenging for me to move my arm as much as I'd like. Unfortunately, my recent bout of updating my website and working on other online projects has put a significant strain on my body, leaving me with barely enough strength to engage in any physical activity, including drawing. The lack of sleep has only added to my discomfort, making it a particularly trying time for me. Although I'm not thrilled with my current situation, I'm confident that I'll make a full recovery. My mother's recent surgery has been successful, and her eyesight has shown significant improvement. She can now perceive fuzzy shapes and colors, although she still struggles with her overall vision. I'm hopeful that she'll regain her full vision soon.

original: Kindness of strangers... Attempted laundry today with the kids in tow and realized how very quickly the simplest things can become a freaking ordeal. I also learned how remarkably sweet total strangers can be for no reason other than because they feel like being sweet. Trust me. It wasn't like they were trying to get into my pants or anything. I had kid drool all over me and was wearing my 'wash-day' outfit... Also, i'm not surper sure i'll ever be bathing again so it's not like there was even an olefactory incentive there! i am doing two things right now. I am composing an post and i am also watching the collected no doubt videos. I am doing both of these things sitting at my desk in my room.
polished: I had an unexpected experience today, attempting to do laundry with my kids in tow. It was astonishingly quick how the most mundane tasks can become a daunting ordeal. I was struck by how remarkably kind total strangers can be, simply because they feel inclined to be kind. It wasn't as if they were trying to gain something from me or anything. I had a child's drool all over me and was wearing my 'wash-day' outfit. To make matters worse, I'm not sure I'll ever feel the need to bathe again, so there wasn't even an olfactory incentive there! Currently, I'm accomplishing two tasks simultaneously. I'm composing this post and simultaneously watching the collected no doubt videos. I'm doing both of these tasks from the comfort of my room, seated at my desk.

original: So it is 11:14pm mst, and here i sit in my bedroom fixing the personal computer of the personnel director from my job. Not that i mind doing it, but i wonder sometimes at how often i find myself fixing someone else's computer as a favour. I'm glad to be able to love and minister to people this way, but where is the line drawn where it comes to the point that you are being taken advantage of? the last couple of weeks, i've been staying up late reading and such, so i was looking forward to hitting the sack early, until i realized it would be more prudent to get this computer out of my bedroom and back into its owner's hands. *laugh* no rest for the weary, right? so i found myself watching joe schmo 2 again tonight.
polished: As I sit here in my bedroom at 11:14 pm MST, I'm currently occupied with fixing the personal computer of my job's personnel director. While I don't mind lending a helping hand, I often find myself pondering the line that separates helping others from being taken advantage of. It's a peculiar phenomenon that has been on my mind lately, especially with the recent late nights spent reading and unwinding. I was looking forward to an early night's rest, but it seemed more practical to prioritize getting this computer back to its rightful owner. *laughs* Alas, no rest for the weary, it seems. Instead, I'm currently engrossed in a rerun of Joe Schmo 2 for the umpteenth time tonight.

original: Remind me, what did i write about before this? or, a continuation in the 'is this a date?' saga so, after the weird lunch, my confidence shook, i forgot to tell you guys an important piece of the story. Before pat shows up to lunch, dustin starts talking about what a nice guy pat is and how he's trying to find a girlfriend for him. I'm listening and nodding and realizing that we're talking more about finding dustin's best friend a girl, than discussing whatever it is you discuss with a stranger over pink lemonade. I excused myself to the bathroom, looked in the mirror and then silently asked myself: am i being pawned off to the other guy? is this what happens now?
polished: I'm trying to recall what I wrote about before this, or perhaps a continuation of the 'Is this a date?' saga. After the unusual lunch, my confidence wavered, and I forgot to share an important piece of the story with you all. Prior to Pat's arrival at lunch, Duston began discussing what a wonderful person Pat is and his efforts to find a girlfriend for himself. As I listened attentively, I realized that we were conversing more about finding Duston's ideal partner than discussing any topic with a stranger over pink lemonade. I excused myself to the bathroom, gazed into the mirror, and then silently posed the question to myself  Am I being pawned off to the other guy? Is this the turning point in our interaction?

original: I would like everyone to think before they act. Actually.. I'd like each and every single person in the world to think before they get out of bed in the morning, and make a commitment to keep thinking all day, and if they're not prepared to, i'd like very much that they'd hop the fuck back in bed, and drift off to an eternal slumber. I'm sick to death of stupid people. No i'm not the smartest motherfucker in the world... But i'm not talking about things that take a lot of brain power, so i think its fair to persecute the inanely stupid. Lets see if i can keep this particular rant to a few particular types, and we'll save some for another day, sound good? great.
polished: I implore everyone to pause for a moment before acting impulsively. I would like each and every individual in the world to take a moment to reflect before rising from bed in the morning, and make a commitment to cultivate mindfulness throughout the day. If they're not prepared to do so, I'd like it if they would reconsider their actions and return to the comfort of their bed, allowing themselves the opportunity to recharge and rejuvenate. I'm exasperated by the prevalence of thoughtless behavior. While I'm not claiming to be the most intelligent individual, I do believe it's reasonable to address the instances of mindless actions. Let's focus on a specific type of behavior for today, and reserve other topics for another time, sound reasonable?

original: Two problems with the scenario outlined in my previous post: 1. True, bush is stimulating the economy, but in the wrong way. Urllink robert rubin told npr's marketplace today that bush could have achieved the same stimulus effect without the long term debt hangover by enacting different tax cuts, temporary tax cuts that would benefit low and middle income persons. Ah, robert rubin. The sound of his name is music to our ears. Quick: name one bush administration cabinet official on the domestic side with rubin's gravitas. Still thinking? it'll come to you... 2. We can't give the republicans control only in wartime because they've ingeniously concocted an endless, global 'war on terrorism.'
polished: Two significant concerns arise from the scenario outlined in my previous post  1. While the Bush administration's economic stimulus package is stimulating the economy, it is doing so in a way that will ultimately lead to a long-term debt hangover. According to Robert Rubin, the former Treasury Secretary, a more effective stimulus package could have been achieved without incurring long-term debt by implementing targeted, temporary tax cuts that would benefit low- and middle-income individuals. The mention of his name is music to our ears, as he is a respected voice in economic policy. Quickly, can anyone name a Bush administration cabinet official with Rubin's gravitas? Perhaps it will come to us... 2. Moreover, we cannot afford to give the Republicans control only in wartime, as they have ingeniously concocted an endless, global 'war on terrorism' that has become a self-perpetuating excuse for military intervention and fiscal recklessness.

original: Do you ever have one of those moments when you begin to reflect on life? like you're sitting in math class bored out of your skull, and you wonder what exactly goes on in your brain that makes you understand math? and you realize that you exist and you are in math class and you wonder why. Then you realize how amazing existing is. And suddenly it hits you-the fact that you are going off on this random train of thought is incredibly pathetic. Ever had that happen? i hate that. You know what else i hate? block schedules. Who would ever come up with that idea? anyone can see that sitting through a two and a half hour class in any subject is cruel and unusual punishment.
polished: Do you ever experience those moments of introspection, when you find yourself lost in thought, sitting in a seemingly mundane setting, such as a math class, and suddenly, you're struck by the profound realization that you're alive and you're in a classroom, and you wonder why you're there. The existential crisis that follows is both humbling and thought-provoking. It's as if you're on the verge of a profound epiphany, only to be interrupted by the harsh reality of your own mortality. And then, in an instant, you're left feeling a mix of emotions - a mix of awe, frustration, and perhaps a dash of embarrassment. Have you ever had that experience? I, for one, detest it. You know what else I detest? Rigid, inflexible schedules. Who, in their infinite wisdom, thought it was a good idea to subject students to the torture of a two-and-a-half-hour class in any subject? It's a wonder anyone can look at the clock and think it's

original: Well... Today's been a long day. We had to drive home from indiana. I guess i'm gonna sort of have to be choosy what i write about because i could really take up a lot of time and space and i just don't have enough energy. First off i have to say that camp was awesome and even better than i could have expected. God's been doing so much stuff in my life lately and it's just awesome. I've sort of turned over a new leaf i guess, but anyway's back to the beginning. We arrived at the twiggs' house on friday evening and we stayed until we left for camp on monday. polished: It has been a long day today. We drove home from Indiana, and I'm feeling a bit fatigued. Given my limited energy levels, I'll have to be judicious about what I write about. However, I must start by expressing my enthusiasm for camp, which was truly exceptional and exceeded my expectations. God has been blessing me with numerous blessings in my life lately, and it's truly remarkable. I've undergone a transformation, and I'm excited to share my experiences. We arrived at the Twiggs' residence on Friday evening and stayed until our departure for camp on Monday. Our activities primarily consisted of visiting the fair, attending church, a parade, shopping at Walmart, and watching movies.

original: Today is my last day of summer vacation! waaaaaa! and i have a dentist appointment at 9. I hate that, but i'd rather get it over with than try to schedule it during the first month of my surgery rotation. I'm definitely nervous, scared, jittery, and any other words you can think up for 'hell's no, me's don wanna go' to school. This is going to be a whole new ball game for me. As a perfectionist, i love excelling at everything i do. But starting new things is a bitch. I hate being a pawn (like i told cassie: 'i'm going to be the only pawn on the chessboard who insists on moving like a knight'), and i hate not knowing what's going on.
polished: Today marks the end of my summer vacation, and I'm filled with a mix of emotions as I prepare to tackle the next chapter. I have a dentist appointment scheduled for 9 00 AM, which I'm not exactly thrilled about, but I'm willing to get it over with before the start of my surgery rotation. As I'm about to embark on this new journey, I must admit that I'm feeling a sense of nervousness, apprehension, and uncertainty. As a perfectionist, I thrive on excelling in everything I do, but starting anew can be daunting. I'm particularly disheartened by the prospect of feeling like a pawn in the grand scheme, as I've confided to a close friend, Cassie, that I'd rather not be the only one who approaches challenges with a knight's unpredictable moves. The uncertainty of what lies ahead is unsettling, and I'm not looking forward to not being in control.

original: Arun shourie talks about how, the present governor of uttar pradesh had warned, as far back as 1996, about the impending threat of the rise of a urllink ' third islamic state ' in the subcontinent . T v rajeswar, the former head of the intelligence bureau and the present governor of uttar pradesh had predicted this dire threat in a series of articles published in the hindustan times, way back in 1996. Shourie raises a valid point when he says, does the fact that you now know that he, and not i, to say nothing of mr advani, wrote all that make the warnings ring true? or do you conclude that because he wrote in this refrain, t v rajeswar is a closet communalist and should not be allowed to continue as governor of uttar pradesh?
polished: Arun Shourie highlights a significant point, underscoring how the current Governor of Uttar Pradesh, T V Rajeswar, had issued a warning as far back as 1996 about the looming threat of the emergence of a 'third Islamic state' in the subcontinent. As the former head of the Intelligence Bureau and current Governor of Uttar Pradesh, Rajeswar had previously published a series of articles in the Hindustan Times, warning of this dire threat. Shourie raises a pertinent question when he asks, does the fact that we now know that Rajeswar, rather than he or Mr. Advani, wrote these warnings make them more credible? Or does one conclude that, given Rajeswar's repeated warnings, he is a closet communalist and therefore unfit to continue serving as Governor of Uttar Pradesh?

original: All of a sudden, for the past two days, i have been overcome with terrible bouts of exhaustion. Bone dead exhaustion. Last evening, i went home, and just slept off, and only got up when my mother called me around eight thirty. And when i woke up, it was all dark, and i hadn't switched the lights on, so i could not figure out what time or date it was, for a few seconds, it was just my mother's voice in the darkness and me grappling with reality. Wonder why i'm feeling so drained... Nice weather this morning. It was drizzling when i came. Although in calcutta i hear it's been raining for the past three days.
polished: I've been overwhelmed with an inexplicable exhaustion for the past two days. The fatigue has been relentless, leaving me feeling utterly drained. Yesterday evening, I returned home, collapsed onto my bed, and slept through the night, only rousing when my mother called me around 8 30 pm. As I slowly came to, it was pitch dark, and I hadn't even bothered to turn on the lights, so for a few disorienting moments, it was just my mother's soothing voice in the darkness, and me struggling to regain my bearings. I couldn't help but wonder why I'm feeling so utterly exhausted... The morning was surprisingly pleasant, with a gentle drizzle outside, a welcome respite from the torrential rain that, I'm told, has been relentless in Kolkata for the past three days.

original: Last night was the worst. I threw away the sweater i was knitting. I only had about 14 inches. I lost probably $10 worth of yarn (it's $8 a skein). But it had too many stitches by the time i got to the arm holes and the mohair was knotting itself together as i knitted, so frogging (ripping out rows) didn't work well. The yarn broke a lot. I didn't even swear, which is unusual for me. I just morosely ripped and listened to season two of sex and the city (way to go, library!). And then i got sick of it and threw it away. I suppose i could say i learned a lot while trying to do this sweater.
polished: Last night, I had a particularly frustrating experience with my knitting project. I regret to admit that I discarded the sweater I was working on, as it had reached only about 14 inches in length. The yarn, which was worth approximately $10, had become increasingly knotted and tangled, making it difficult to frogging (ripping out rows) and salvage the project. In fact, the yarn broke frequently, which was quite vexing. I must admit that I didn't even curse, which is unusual for me, as I am not one to give in to frustration easily. Instead, I opted to take a break and indulge in a different activity - watching season two of Sex and the City, which I found quite engaging. However, I eventually grew tired of it and, in a moment of exasperation, I discarded the sweater. Despite the setback, I suppose I did learn a valuable lesson from the experience and will approach my next project with a more patient and methodical approach.

original: Last night in class, we were discussing that week’s assigned reading, urllink getting back into place: toward a renewed study of the place-world, by edward s. Casey . The first chapter deals with “implacement” and the second, “displacement.” in the first chapter, casey makes the distinction that our contemporary world and culture revolves around time as the situating force: we are running out of time, we have saved time, we are just in time. He is trying to make the case that using place as the center of culture gives a more grounded community. (that is a very rough summation, a disclaimer just in case my professor or any other classmate happens to read this post.) so far, this book is the first reading that has grabbed me by the proverbial shoulders.
polished: In our recent class discussion, we delved into the assigned reading, 'Toward a Renewed Study of the Place-World' by Edward S. Casey. The first chapter, 'Implacement,' and the second, 'Displacement,' offered a fascinating exploration of the concepts that shape our understanding of the world. Casey posits that our contemporary culture and society are dominated by the force of time, which he argues is a situating force that drives our daily lives. We are constantly racing against time, trying to make the most of the hours we have, and yet, paradoxically, we are often stuck in the present moment. Casey's central argument is that by placing place at the forefront of our cultural considerations, we can cultivate a more grounded sense of community and belonging. This book has had a profound impact on me, as it is the first reading to have truly resonated with me and sparked a deeper appreciation for the importance of place in shaping our experiences.

original: Whatever it is they put into freeze pops to make them those colours, there should be some sort of warning: may make your life a bit bizarre. And whilst giggling is good, one wonders if we would have found ourselves up that fire escape drinking beer in the fierce wind had we not been eating them earlier. Finding ourselves in a doorway to a bar sadly closed for business, we stopped to examine an office-supplies catalogue that had arrived in the post. Lucky we did. Who could possibly have guessed that within these pages were the special offers of a lifetime? not i, for certain. I list but a few: buy 36 permanent marker pens, get a stunt kite. Buy 30 lever arch files, get a barbecue.
polished: As it appears, whatever creative liberties are taken to craft the vibrant colors within freeze pops, there must be a clear warning  a hint of the unusual may make one's life a bit unconventional. While laughter is an excellent coping mechanism, one cannot help but wonder if we would have found ourselves stumbling upon that inferno, sipping beer in the midst of a fierce wind, had we not been indulging in those sweet treats earlier. Finding ourselves at the doorstep of a bar, unfortunately closed for business, we took a moment to peruse an office-supplies catalogue that had arrived in the mail. Fate smiled upon us. Who could have predicted that within these pages lay the extraordinary offers of a lifetime? Not I, for certain. I list but a few  purchase 36 permanent marker pens, receive a stunt kite. Purchase 30 lever arch files, receive a barbecue.

original: Currently listening to: the little drummer boy by stevan pasero ...and now my post... Senate republicans okay, hands up - who watched the 39-hour judicial nominations wankathon last week? i know i didn't. Well, okay - i did tune in once or twice. The entire colossal waste of time was perpetrated by republicans who, pissed off that democrats wouldn't roll over and nominate four of bush's nutjob justices, were trying to score political points by holding a multi-day cry-fest. Never mind the fact that the democrats have already approved 168 of bush's judicial nominees - nooo, that's not good enough for the power-mad republicans who are for some reason laboring under the misapprehension they have a huge mandate for this kind of nonsense.
polished: I'm currently listening to 'The Little Drummer Boy' by Stevan Pasero. Meanwhile, I'd like to share my thoughts on the recent Senate proceedings. The 39-hour marathon session to confirm judicial nominations was a colossal waste of time. The Republican Senators, frustrated that the Democrats wouldn't rubber-stamp President Bush's judicial appointments without question, resorted to grandstanding and scoring political points. It was a spectacle that was nothing more than a cry-fest. It's astonishing, considering the Democrats have already confirmed 168 of President Bush's judicial nominees. The Republicans' actions are a testament to their power-hungry nature, as they seem to believe they have a mandate to engage in such political posturing.

original: This was a good weekend. I did a lot of god's green leaf, after a long time, i listened to a lot of nevermore (something i should have started doing much earlier) and read a lot. I finished three books over the weekend - bruce sterling's heavy weather, larry niven's world of ptavvs and octavia butler's parable of the sower. Heavy weather was a good cyberpunk romp through a near-future usa, devastated by global warming and general anarchy. While it was clever, well-paced and altogether very convincing, i must confess that i failed to come away with any really significant sensations about the story or the characters. Not that both aren't well constructed and vividly etched - it's a good book, but not a great one, i guess.
polished: This weekend was a truly rejuvenating experience. After a prolonged period of inactivity, I devoted a considerable amount of time to indulging in my favorite pastime, reading. I made up for lost time by devouring an impressive three books  Bruce Sterling's 'Heavy Weather', Larry Niven's 'World of Ptavvs', and Octavia Butler's 'Parable of the Sower'. 'Heavy Weather' was an engrossing cyberpunk romp set in a dystopian near-future United States ravaged by the devastating effects of global warming and societal collapse. Although it was a well-crafted and engaging novel, I must admit that I failed to derive any profound insights or lasting impressions from the story or its characters. The world-building and character development were commendable, but the narrative ultimately lacked a deeper emotional resonance, leaving me with a sense of 'good, but not great'.

original: Coz' this is the aftermath the first week back from practicum was a struggle but it is only in the second week that the smoke has really started to clear. Post-practicum trauma was a hidden epidemic that is only now coming to light. I was stricken but with the eventual meeting with the course co-ordinator allowed me to release my burden and by doing so i have prevented another person being stuck with such a pedagogically deficit practicum school. Yesterday (monday) i bumped into another agrieved classmate who was quite determined to go to the student who was due to go to her school in the next practicum and tell him how terrible it will be. I calmed her down and said that we should go to the administrator first.
polished: After the first week back from practicum, I experienced a challenging aftermath, but it wasn't until the second week that the haze of uncertainty finally began to clear. The post-practicum trauma that I had been carrying was only now coming to light. I was initially overwhelmed, but a meeting with the course coordinator allowed me to release my burden, and in doing so, I was able to prevent another student from being stuck with a pedagogically deficient practicum experience. Yesterday, on Monday, I ran into another agitated classmate who was determined to warn a fellow student about the difficulties they would face in the upcoming practicum. I calmed her down and suggested that we should report to the administrator first, together.

polished: Life has been quite hectic lately, but I always make time for stress-relieving activities. I've discovered that I'm not particularly skilled at 8-ball and ping-pong, as Rick, affectionately known as the Canuck, consistently outplays me. Fortunately, we have a ping-pong table in the front lobby of our building, making it easy to squeeze in a quick game whenever I need to unwind. Last night, I participated in an 8-ball tournament at our recreation tent, which is equipped with a popcorn machine, multiple TVs, a jukebox, DVD rentals, a pool table, dartboard, and a ping-pong table. I had a decent run throughout my one entire game, until I accidentally scratched on the eight ball. Despite this mishap, I still had a fantastic time, with the highlight being the two Dutch soldiers who joined the tournament and added to the excitement.

original: Fall 1974: i was attempting for what felt like the 13th time to fight my way through the second chapter of my high school algebra book. I was not then nor am i now a math person. I hate math. I am math phobic. You get the picture. So as i struggled to make sense out of algebra the doorbell rang. I put down my book and went to open the door. No one was there. Great. I returned to my studies and just as i was finding a little glimmer of understanding buried in my sub conscious the doorbell rang again. Bam, just like that my breakthrough disappeared. I went to the door and once again no one was there. Just what a struggling math student needs, an uninvited practical joker.
polished: Autumn 1974 was a season of frustration for me, as I grappled with the seemingly insurmountable task of navigating the second chapter of my high school algebra textbook. As a self-proclaimed math-phobe, I was dreading the experience. I had already failed to grasp the concepts multiple times before, and I was no closer to comprehension now. The doorbell rang, interrupting my struggles, and I hesitated, wondering if I was being pranked. I put down my book and made my way to the door, only to find no one there. Feeling a mix of relief and annoyance, I returned to my studies, determined to make progress. Just as I was starting to grasp a glimmer of understanding, the doorbell rang once more. My breakthrough was short-lived, as I found myself once again at the door, only to be met with an empty hallway. It was as if the universe was playing a cruel joke on a struggling math student like me.

original: This past week has been nothing short of exhausting. I spent tuesday-thursday finishing the move to my new classroom. The new room is bigger and closer to my grade level team, these are the things i need to consider as i spend hours upon hours preparing my room for this year. Had i known i was going to move prior to the end of my school year, i would have discarded much of the books and supplies i no longer use. Unfortunately, it all came with me. So this week was spent moving, unpacking, and purging profusely. I have to thank my teammate jill for helping with all of this. You see, she was still teaching this month, in my old room. So she and her lovely students moved almost my entire room for me!
polished: This past week has been nothing short of an arduous experience. I spent Tuesday to Thursday dedicating my time to relocating to my new classroom. The new room is spacious and conveniently situated near my grade-level colleagues, which are crucial considerations as I invest countless hours in preparing my workspace for the upcoming year. If I had known I was going to make the move before the end of my school year, I would have discarded a significant portion of the books and supplies I no longer require. Unfortunately, everything came with me. Consequently, this week was spent on the laborious tasks of moving, unpacking, and purging an abundance of unnecessary items. I must express my sincere gratitude to my teammate, Jill, for her invaluable assistance throughout this ordeal. As she was still teaching this month in my old room, she kindly agreed to help me relocate almost my entire room, and her lovely students were equally accommodating in their efforts.

original: I'm uncomfortable. Investigative reporting seems very wrong to me. Or let me rephrase that, the article i'm doing and it's consequences is not exactly something i'm comfortable with. Perhaps it is because i don't believe in it enough, that i cannot really get the complete feel for it. The angst behind it. The full-out passion towards it to question. I've grown up in a country where you don't ask questions. Really, you just don't. They shoot you for that shit. They put you in jail with all these internal security acts. I am not used to this freedom of speech...not used to questioning out loud. Sure, i am not the easiest person to get along with.
polished: I am discomfited by investigative reporting, and I must rephrase my perspective. The article I am writing and its consequences are not entirely aligned with my values, which is why I struggle to fully immerse myself in the subject matter. Perhaps it's because I lack sufficient conviction, which prevents me from fully embracing it. The underlying emotions and passion behind it are not resonating with me. I've grown up in a culture where questioning authority is not encouraged. In fact, asking questions can be met with hostility and even persecution. I am not accustomed to this freedom of speech, and I am not comfortable expressing my doubts aloud. As someone who is not always easy to get along with others, I find it challenging to navigate these complex issues.

original: We had an outing yesterday with my co-employees at the bank. We went to guintubdan, la carolota. It was the first time for most of us. We trekked for the falls. It was a 30 minute or so walk. We were all catching our breaths. Whew! but we made it. The water was chilly ice. You can feel your body getting numb because of the coldness. We only stayed less than an hour because we headed for the nearby waterfalls. Another 30 minutes of trekking. But the trip was worth it because the falls looked calming and the whole scene is indeed breathtaking. Its like you can hear yourself being one with nature. Soaking myself in the cold water was like communing with mother earth. The cold air and water were enough to make you be lulled to sleep.
polished: Yesterday, I embarked on an outing with my colleagues from the bank to Guintubdan, La Carlota, a destination that was a first for most of us. The trek to the falls was a 30-minute journey, during which we all caught our breaths. Upon arrival, we were met with a breathtaking sight  the water was icy cold, and the chill was palpable, making our bodies numb. We spent less than an hour at the falls before continuing on to the nearby waterfalls, another 30-minute trek. However, the excursion was well worth the effort, as the scenery was nothing short of stunning. The tranquil atmosphere and the majestic falls created a sense of oneness with nature, allowing me to feel as though I was communing with the earth itself. The combination of the cold air and water was so soothing that it almost lulled me to sleep.

original: Saturday we took connor to firemans park, thinking that the fireman's easter egg hunt was to start at 11am. It turned out it was on the friday. Thank goodness i brought a bag of eggs with me just incase. So connor had a great time finding eggs out in the park. Sunday morning when he woke up he was so excited that the easter bunny had come. There is nothing better then to see the excitement on your childs face. After egg hunting, we all went to church. Even though the 'easter bunny' is fun and all. We do make sure our kids know the true meaning of the holidays. This was megan's first easter, she looked so cute dressed in her jean dress and stockings :)
polished: On Saturday, we took Connor to Fireman's Park, anticipating that the fire department's Easter egg hunt would commence at 11 a.m. However, we were pleasantly surprised to discover that it was actually scheduled for Friday instead. I'm grateful that I brought a bag of eggs along, just in case, and Connor thoroughly enjoyed searching for eggs throughout the park. On Sunday morning, when he woke up, he was absolutely thrilled that the Easter bunny had visited. There's nothing quite like witnessing the unbridled excitement on a child's face. After our egg-hunting adventure, we all attended church, where we emphasized the true meaning of the holiday, even though the Easter bunny is a fun and festive tradition. This was Megan's first Easter, and she looked adorable in her jean dress and stockings.

I was excited to receive the boots, specifically the Tredair Flame Boots, which I had been eagerly anticipating. However, my excitement was short-lived as I soon realized that I had gotten a flat tire. Fortunately, I was at work, and my colleagues kindly offered to inflate it for me and ensure it held air. I might consider purchasing a new tire tonight, as I had previously thought I had acquired another VW. However, it appears that was just an illusion.

original: I know in a previous post i protected parents, almost even taking their side, well here's my little change of mind. Parents don't know anything. They think they know you soooo well, maybe even to the point where they can read emotions off your face. They can't. Parents know nothing about us. And when i go upstairs after arguing with nicole about kelli, like i just did a few minutes ago, and they want me to tell them what's wrong. Yeah, how about you shut the fuck up!? i don't have to tell you what's wrong all the time. Here's the situation with nicole and kelli. Kelli and nicole don't like each other. At all.
polished: I've had a change of heart regarding my previous stance on my parents. I've been inclined to take their side, almost instinctively, but I've come to realize that they're not as well-versed in our lives as they think they are. They're often misinformed and misguided, and their assumptions about us are often based on their own biases and lack of understanding. When I go upstairs to discuss my issues with Nicole after arguing with Kelli, I'm often met with demands that I share what's wrong. It's exhausting to constantly have to explain myself, and it's not fair to expect me to do so. The situation with Nicole and Kelli is complicated, to say the least. They've never gotten along, and their differences are deeply ingrained.

original: Urllink some people are jumping to connect urllink this dot : the urllink organization for security and cooperation in europe was invited to monitor the election by the state department. The observers will come from the osce's office for democratic institutions and human rights. It will be the first time such a team has been present for a u.s. Presidential election. With urllink this dot : a baker's dozen of congressional democrats, among them four new yorkers, has petitioned u.n. Secretary- general kofi annan to dispatch international observers to florida to oversee this year's presidential balloting there. I humbly disagree. Based on the info available, the osce seems to be coming here to learn from the u.s. Election process, not to oversee it, which was the original partisan and childish call for u.n.
polished: The United States Department of State has invited the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) to monitor the upcoming presidential election in Florida. The OSCE will send observers to the election, marking the first time such a team has been present for a U.S. presidential election. The OSCE has invited a baker's dozen of congressional Democrats, including four New Yorkers, to petition UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan to dispatch international observers to Florida to oversee this year's presidential ballot. It is worth noting that the OSCE seems to be coming to learn from the U.S. election process, rather than to oversee it, which was the original partisan and childish call for UN.

original: Gop gets scolded on recruitment naturalization ceremonies in jacksonville are to be relocated after complaints that gop activists registered new citizens as republicans. By gary fineout and alfonso chardy the citizenship ceremony in jacksonville seemed to go off as usual, with a crowd of nearly 200 people going home as new americans. Just before the new citizens left the june 29 event, an immigration official directing the swearing-in urged them to stop by a voter registration table -- a not uncommon sight at naturalization ceremonies. But this table was unusual: those handing out forms were republican volunteers -- and the party affiliation box had been checked off ahead of time to make all of the new voters members of the gop. All of it was suspicious to linda cross, who was there to watch her husband, dario cruz, take his citizenship oath.
polished: The naturalization ceremonies in Jacksonville, where GOP activists registered new citizens as Republicans, have been relocated after complaints that the ceremonies were being politicized. Despite this, the citizenship ceremony on June 29th, which was attended by nearly 200 people, proceeded as usual, with a sense of normalcy. Just before the new citizens departed, an immigration official, directing the swearing-in, urged them to stop by a voter registration table, where a group of Republican volunteers were handing out voter registration forms. The party affiliation box had been checked off ahead of time to ensure that all of the new voters became members of the GOP. The scene was observed by Linda Cross, who was present to witness her husband, Dario Cruz, take his citizenship oath.

polished: I take great pride in ensuring that every guest who visits Casa Pescatore feels as comfortable as possible, as if they were in their own home. I strive to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere, where everyone can feel at ease and at peace. Yesterday, I'm thrilled to say that I succeeded in hosting a memorable gathering on Perry Avenue, which many people consider 'extreme prejudice.' 4 30 pm was the time when my best friend Eric and his son Nunu arrived with a massive pan of baked ziti. The tables were set, and I had prepared all the dishes I had cooked, and the bells were ringing in celebration. Just as I could barely blink, my best friend from Florida walked through the door, and that filled me with joy. I missed him dearly. The cherry on top was him bringing his wife along. She's expecting, and this is the closest I could get to being an uncle. I spoiled that girl with tray after tray of food and tiramisu, and I couldn't be more grateful.

original: I liked the idea of that as an offence - maybe that could've been a way out of being burned as a witch. As a non-american blogger i've been a little reluctant to get involved in some of these discussions, particularly the bits about flags, but since i started it (the subject, not the flag-burning) i suppose i'd better say something. Firstly, i think that the idea of having a law against flag-burning is completely nuts. The moment you start according a symbol - any symbol - that kind of automatic reverence and protection, you've taken a small but important step towards totalitarianism. Symbols are kind of fickle - they don't a priori represent anything in themselves; it's what they are perceived as meaning or made to represent that's important.
polished: I find the concept of flag-burning laws to be quite misguided. As a non-American blogger, I've been hesitant to engage in certain discussions, particularly those revolving around the flag-burning debate. However, since I've been drawn into it, I feel compelled to share my thoughts. In my opinion, the notion of automatically bestowing legal protection upon a symbol, regardless of its meaning or perceived significance, is a slippery slope towards authoritarianism. Symbols can be fleeting and context-dependent, and their meaning is often shaped by the way they are perceived or intentionally designed to convey. It's crucial to recognize that symbols, in and of themselves, do not inherently possess inherent meaning; it's the meaning we assign to them that truly matters.

I'm a bit anxious, to be honest, as I'm worried about the thought of it. However, I'm also extremely excited to see him, a mix of emotions, I suppose. The Leafs played last night, but Calgary was playing at the same time, and I'm on the west coast, so I had to watch the Calgary game instead of the Leafs game. It's all good, I guess, considering my Leafs lost, and that's what makes me a bit sad. However, Philly is a great team, so I still have bragging rights. They made it farther than the Canucks today, and today is a crazy day.

original: Ok, so i have yet to see what my blog will actually look like. But apparently, this is the place to start. I am not quite sure what will be happening here; whether i will take to it and whatnot, but since i spend so much of my time in front of a machine, i might as well make proper use of my time and post all these bits of craziness that whiz around, nay stumble around more like, in my head. I was insipired by a blogger (who i never met in person), who managed to keep us up to date in the most intimate fashion about her day to day existance, and somewhat entertained at the same time...
polished: I'm excited to see what my blog will look like, but for now, this is the place to start. I'm not quite sure what will happen here, whether I'll take to it and whatnot, but since I spend a significant amount of time in front of a machine, I might as well make proper use of my time and share all these bits of craziness that whiz around in my head. I was inspired by a blogger who kept us up to date in the most intimate fashion about her daily existence, and somehow managed to entertain us at the same time. I'm looking forward to seeing how this all unfolds.

original: 1. Everyone is obsessed with one movie or series of movies, what's yours? evil dead series.. If it wasn't obvious. (i have one of the largest 'stuff from that movie series' collections ever) 2. Can you play an instrument? what is it? bass guitar, oh yes, i rock out. 3. Biggest money wasting vice? either my compulsive buying of dvds or any new technology. 4. Have any phobias, allergies, or compulsive behaviors? no, no, and i must bank-face all moneys in my wallet in order from least to greatest at all times. 5. How much wood could a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood? because i said so.
polished: 1. What's your guilty pleasure when it comes to movies? Are you obsessed with a particular film or series? For instance, I have an impressive collection of memorabilia from the 'Evil Dead' series. 2. Can you play a musical instrument? I'm a bit of a rockstar on the bass guitar. 3. What's the most extravagant way you waste your money? Do you have a tendency to overspend on DVDs or the latest technology? 4. Are there any phobias, allergies, or compulsive behaviors you're aware of? I'm actually quite rational with my finances, always ensuring I have a steady flow of money in my wallet, from smallest to largest denomination at all times. 5. The age-old question  how much wood could a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood? It's a classic tongue-twister, but I've always loved it.

original: Holla so i saw troy tonight with my family...i was not impressed. I'm too tired to go way into specifics, but i do think it had potential. However, i think too much energy was spent on the set (which was magnificent) and not enough on creating a solidifying tone, theme, etc. It retold the story, but it was not particularly gripping, and i don't feel like i gained anything from watching it. The character development was rather weak. Additionally, i thought the score was poor, and was basically a knock-off of the gladiator. The gladiator used the background music of a moaning woman and it worked b/c it backed up and complemented a genuinely gripping narrative.
polished: I recently had the opportunity to watch Troy with my family, and unfortunately, I was not impressed. I'm too exhausted to go into great detail, but I do think the production had potential. However, I believe too much energy was spent on the set design, which was magnificent, and not enough on establishing a solidifying tone, theme, and character development. The retelling of the story was decent, but it failed to leave a lasting impression, and I don't feel like I gained anything from watching it. The character development was somewhat lacking, and I thought the score was subpar, and it felt like a knock-off of the Gladiator. The Gladiator used the background music of a moaning woman, which effectively backed up and complemented a genuinely gripping narrative.

original: Urllink lets all give a big hello to the newest atom/rdf/rss reader on the block, urllink pulpfiction 1.0 from urllink freshly squeezed software . It looks like it has a lot of native app goodness. It should be noted that it is not free or free, since that seems to be a 'hot topic' on the interweb again. You can try it for 15 days and then go back to something else, or pony up $25 if you like it. A feature that jumps out at me right away is how each post is its own entity, and can be moved around, stored, labeled, and even deleted. I could easily see how this would make some news tracker type people very happy. It imports and exports opml, as you might expect.
polished: Here's a warm welcome to the latest Atom/RDF/ RSS reader on the block, Pulpfiction 1.0, brought to you by Urllink, a freshly squeezed software company. This application appears to be packed with native app-like features. It's worth noting that it's not a free or open-source solution, as this seems to be a hot topic on the internet once again. You can try it for 15 days, after which you can return to another option, or invest in the full version for $25 if you find it useful. A notable feature that stands out immediately is the ability to treat each post as its own entity, allowing for easy organization, storage, labeling, and deletion. This feature would likely be a major hit with news tracker enthusiasts. It supports the import and export of OPML, as you would expect from a news reader.

original: Today... I miss my sister terribly - it just seems strange not to have her hanging around, irritating me (just joking...). Even though it was only for a week, she really made her presence felt, and i mean that in a good way. Just doing the scrapbook for our trtip to tasmania brings fond memories of a time past recently - last week in fact. Maybe it's just the thought that i won't see her for quite a while - with her going to bristol in sept/oct and all. She represented, on a deeper level, a link to my family back home. Oh how i miss them all. Tomorrow is the start of a new term. How did the holidays fly by so quickly?
polished: I am deeply missing my sister, and it feels strange not to have her around, teasing me playfully. Although she was only with me for a week, she made her presence felt, and I mean that in a positive way. The memory of our trip to Tasmania, which was just a week ago, brings back fond memories of a time not so long ago. The thought of not seeing her for a while, as she will be in Bristol in September and October, is a daunting one. She represented a deep connection to my family back home, and I am grateful for that. I miss them all, and tomorrow marks the start of a new term. It's hard to believe that the holidays flew by so quickly.

original: Ever have one of those days when you just don't know what the... What the... Anything? no? well then you should skip the rest of this because it won't make any sense to you. To those of you choosing to continue on i offer the following observation. ' sometimes i wish i'd been given the manual .' manuals, if done correctly at least, let you know: what things are for, what they can do, how they do the things they do, what happens if you push button x or y, what to do if things aren't doing what they're supposed to the phone number and email address of the omniscient guru who can solve every problem very useful information. Unfortunately i didn't get a manual with me.
polished: Sometimes, you may have those days when you're unsure what the point is or what the purpose is. If you're unsure, you may want to skip the rest of this passage because it may not make sense to you. To those of you who choose to continue, I offer the following observation. I sometimes wish I had been given a comprehensive manual. A well-written manual would provide valuable information, including what things are for, what they can do, how they function, and what to do if things don't work as expected. It would be incredibly useful to have a manual that explains the purpose of the phone number and email address of the all-knowing guru who can solve every problem. Unfortunately, I didn't receive a manual with me, but I'm sure it would have been very useful.

original: And there's nothing wrong with pcs -- if i were a full-bore gamer with time to do such a thing, i'd certainly have a pc system for the wealth of available games. Though except for a few unique products, that huge wall of games at compusa starts getting repetetive after a while -- at first i'm envious, then i start noticing that it's really just a lot of different flavors of the same soda...first-person shooters, mystery games, strategy games, simulations. There are so many variations of age of empires it becomes comical. Aoe -- with orcs! aoe -- with spaceships! aoe -- with fuzzy wombats! it's like the endless movie trailers that begin with the line: 'in a world...'
polished: In a world where gaming is a major part of one's life, there's nothing inherently wrong with playing on a PC. If I were a dedicated gamer with the time and resources to devote to such a pursuit, I would certainly have a powerful PC system capable of handling the vast array of games available. However, the sheer volume of games at the likes of CompuSa can be overwhelming, and after a while, the excitement of discovering new titles wears off. At first, I find myself envying the vast selection, but eventually, I start to notice that it's really just a multitude of variations on the same core concepts. First-person shooters, mystery games, strategy games, and simulations are all part of the same genre, and the sheer number of Age of Empires-style games becomes almost comical. Aoe games, with orcs! Aoe games, with spaceships! Aoe games, with fuzzy wombats! It's like the endless movie trailers that begin with the line  'In a world...'

original: Lblair (non-privileged).pst -----original message----- from: threet, kay sent: thursday, june 28, 2001 11:08 am to: blair, lynn cc: stevens, bob; neville, sue; cabrera, reyna subject: nsp powerpac issues lynn, following our discussion yesterday afternoon, reyna and i came back and reviewed the nsp powerpac agreement. We were specifically looking for language in this agreement which may require us to true up for the customer regardless of whether or not we were allocating storage on a given gas day. We couldn't put our finger on any language in the current agreement (dated april 1, 2001) that requires us to true up for them, but perhaps we overlooked or misinterpreted something.
polished: I am writing to follow up on our discussion yesterday afternoon with Lynn, regarding the Nsp Powerpac agreement. Reyna and I reviewed the agreement and specifically looked for language that may require us to be true to the customer, regardless of whether or not we are allocating storage on a given gas day. Unfortunately, we were unable to find any language in the current agreement (dated April 1, 2001) that explicitly requires us to be truthful about them, which may have led to us overlooking or misinterpreting something.

original: Jdasovic.nsf monday, december 11, 2000 to: all px market participants from: john yurkanin chief operating officer re: loss of continuity in px day ahead auction due to iso rule changes the emergency tariff filing by the california iso last friday has had a negative effect on the px day ahead auction market. The mixture of soft and hard caps results in a complete disconnect and unacceptable risk to all of our participants and will probably not provide the iso with its sought after reduction in real time energy sales and procurement. The overall effect will be that supply will still defer to the higher realized price opportunity the iso offers. The px is petitioning terry winter of the iso to immediately allow for adjustment bids on any submitted schedule at any price relevant.
polished: On December 11, 2000, John Yurkanin, Chief Operating Officer, sent an email to all market participants regarding the loss of continuity in the day-ahead auction due to ISO rule changes, which resulted in an emergency tariff filing by the California ISO last Friday. The combination of soft and hard capacity has led to a complete disconnection and unacceptable risk to all participants, which will probably not provide the ISO with the sought-after reduction in real-time energy sales and procurement. The overall effect will be that supply will still defer to the higher realized price opportunity the ISO offers. The PX is petitioning Terry Winter of the ISO to immediately allow for adjustment bids on any submitted schedule at any price relevant.

original: Mark guzman 6-28-02.nsf just wanted to make sure you saw this from les rawson concerning grays harbor and willamette. -bill beginning immediately enron has purchased control area reserves service from bpa. The allows services to sell unit contingent energy as hourly firm since bpa is suppling reserves for up to 60 minutes. If grays harbor paper notifies rt of a unit derate or outage rt should notify bpa dispatch immediately and make the reduction in the schedule during the next ramp. For example should grays unit trip as 1333 rt would notify bpa and the sink that across the top of the hour for 1400 the schedule would be taken to zero for he 1400. The bottom line is that 60 minutes is the maximum time bpa will carry the schedule.
polished: Mark Guzman, on February 28th, just wanted to ensure that you saw this message from Les Rawson, regarding Grays Harbor and Willamette. Bill, beginning immediately, Enron has purchased control of the area, reserving services from BPA. The allows services to sell unit contingent energy as hourly firm since BPA is supplying reserves for up to 60 minutes. If Grays Harbor Paper notifies RT of a unit derivative or outage RT should notify BPA dispatch immediately and make the reduction in the schedule during the next ramp. For example, should Grays unit trip as 1,333 RT would notify BPA and sink that across the top of the hour for 14 00, the schedule would be taken to zero for he 14 00. The bottom line is that 60 minutes is the maximum time BPA will carry the schedule.

polished:
Here are their credit issues 

1. In the cross-default language, it is specified that if a cross-default occurs, unless the non-defaulting party determines in good faith that performance by the defaulting party of its obligations under the master is "endangered", then no cross default is triggered.

2. In credit event upon merger, we had commented that instead of the "materially weaker" standard, we wanted to specify that it meant being rated below BBB- by S&P. Do you feel strongly about this?

original: Khyatt (non-privileged).pst el paso tests market for mainline expansion el paso natural gas apparently got the message when its last open season for 1.2 bcf/d of firm transportation capacity attracted bids for 14.4 bcf/d. The pipeline has announced an open season to test market interest in a mainline expansion and to satisfy regulatory concerns that something needs to be done to relieve the apparent capacity constraint at the california border. El paso has been under significant pressure from regulators and shippers to expand because of enormous demand and skyrocketing prices in california. In a jan. 3 letter to the pipeline, daniel m. Adamson, director of ferc's office of energy projects, urged el paso to consider modifying its line 2000 project to "assist the difficult situation" now facing the california gas market.
polished: El Paso's non-privileged PST El Paso tests the market for mainline expansion of natural gas, apparently got the message when its last open season for 1.2 bcf/d of firm transportation capacity attracted bids for 14.4 bcf/d. The pipeline has announced an open season to test market interest in a mainline expansion and to satisfy regulatory concerns that something needs to be done to relieve the apparent capacity constraint at the California border. El Paso has been under significant pressure from regulators and shippers to expand due to enormous demand and skyrocketing prices in California. In a January 3 letter to the pipeline, Daniel M. Adamson, director of FERC's office of energy projects, urged El Paso to consider modifying its Line 2000 project to "assist the difficult situation" now facing the California gas market.

original: Sscott5.nsf ahimsa (uh-him-sah) noun the principle of noninjury to living beings. [sanskrit ahimsa : a-, not + himsa, injury (from himsati, he injures).] "as my conception of ahimsa went on maturing, i became more vigilant about my thought and speech. The lines in the anthem: scatter her enemies and make them fall; confound their policies, frustrate their knavish tricks particularly jarred upon my sentiments of ahimsa." m.k. Gandhi, the story of my experiments with truth, 1927. Today is october 2, the day mohandas karamchand gandhi was born in the year 1869. A man born some two centuries ago may appear irrelevant to our age, but in reality his life and message are still applicable to our lives today.
polished: As my conception of ahimsa, the principle of non-injury to living beings, continued to mature. As I became more vigilant about my thought and speech, the lines in the anthem,'scatter her enemies and make them fall; confound their policies, frustrate their knavish tricks particularly jarred upon my sentiments of ahimsa,' resonated deeply within me. Mahatma Gandhi's story of my experiments with truth, recorded in 1927, serves as a testament to the timelessness of his life and message. Born in 1869, Gandhi's life may seem distant to us today, but his struggles and triumphs remain a powerful reminder of the importance of compassion, non-violence, and truth in our own lives.

original: Mgrigsb.nsf ? over the weekend, gov. Davis and senate polance made an informal agreement whereby senate polance has agreed to sponsor the socal mou bill. Polanco is a democrat and is currently suffering through a personal scandal and as a result, it is reported that his political career is essential dead. Polance is planning to run for mayor of los angeles rather than run for another senate term. ? the bill is expected to be introduced in the new extraordinary session, beginning today or tomorrow. The bill would first go to the senate energy committee. Sen. Bowen, the chair of the committee, strongly opposes the mou, so the bill is expected to remain in committee hearings for some time. The longer the bill is involved in committee politics and changes are made, the likelihood of a socal bankruptcy increases.
polished: The Senate and House government officials have reached an informal agreement to sponsor the Social and Cultural Affairs (Socal) bill over the weekend. Senator Polanco, a Democrat, is facing a personal scandal and is reportedly considering running for mayor of Los Angeles instead of seeking another Senate term. The bill is expected to be introduced in the extraordinary session, either today or tomorrow, and will initially be referred to the Senate Energy Committee. Senator Bowen, the committee chair, has expressed strong opposition to the bill, making it likely to remain in committee hearings for an extended period. The bill's involvement in committee politics and the likelihood of a Social and Cultural Affairs bankruptcy increase with each passing day.

original: Sshackle.nsf notice no. 00-338 october 3, 2000 memorandum to: all nymex and comex members from: neal l. Wolkoff, executive vice president date: october 3, 2000 re: notice of cftc approval of new nymex rule 6.40c: ("average price calculations by futures commission merchants") please be advised that the cftc has approved new nymex rule 6.40c ("average price calculations by futures commission merchants"), which is attached and is now in effect. New nymex rule 6.40c, which is consistent with a recent cftc "advisory," permits fcms, under certain conditions specified in the rule, to use their own internal, proprietary systems to generate average price ("ap") calculations when multiple prices are received on an order or series of orders.
polished:
NOTICE TO  All Nymex and Comex Members

From  Neal L. Wolkoff, Executive Vice President
Date  October 3, 2000

Re  Notice of CFTC Approval of New Nymex Rule 6.40C  ("Average Price Calculations by Futures Commission Merchants")

Please be advised that the CFTC has approved New Nymex Rule 6.40C ("Average Price Calculations by Futures Commission Merchants"), which is attached and is now in effect.

New Nymex Rule 6.40C, which is consistent with a recent CFTC "advisory," permits FCMS, under certain conditions specified in the rule, to use their own internal, proprietary systems to generate average price ("AP") calculations when multiple prices are received on an order or series of orders.

Sincerely,
Neal L. Wolkoff
Executive Vice President

original: Sshackle.nsf as of this week enrononline has just started offering us/canadian dollar swaps online. As part of my review in determining whether a counterparty can transact these products online i look at the financial trading agreement database to see if there are any restrictions indicated, check the master swap agreement, and i am also looking at any board resolutions we might have received when we got the master agreement executed. What i am finding is that in the old days when we asked for resolutions evidencing the authority to enter into the master agreement/derivative transactions frequently the resolutions do not allow the counterparies to enter into currency transactions. Since transacting these currency transactions with our energy customers is a new area of business for us i just wanted us all to be mindful to check these old resolutions and not to rely solely on the "restrictions" contained in lotus notes.
polished: As of this week, Enrononline has just started offering US/Canadian dollar swaps online. In my review of determining whether a counterparty can transact these products online, I examine the financial trading agreement database to identify any restrictions indicated, review the master swap agreement, and scrutinize any board resolutions we received when we executed the master agreement. What I am finding is that in the old days, when we requested resolutions to evidence the authority to enter into the master agreement/derivative transactions, the resolutions did not allow the counterparties to enter into currency transactions. Given that transacting these currency transactions with our energy customers is a new area of business for us, I believe it is essential to carefully review these old resolutions and not solely rely on the "restrictions" contained in Lotus Notes.

original: Dhyvl.nsf dave, i will be glad to generate the form of transaction agreement; however, i have a number of questions. 1. Relationship of delivery point and the use of interruptible transport on northwest pipeline. Is the transport upstream or downstream of the delivery point? if downstream, why isn't it being contracted for by eweb. 2. What volume is being sold each day. You use the term dcq and you also talk about a 20% tolerance above or below the estimated quantity. Normally their would be no tolerance with a dcq transaction. 3. Is this envisioned to be a requirements transaction. Is the price the same for volumes in excess of the estimated quantity up to an additional 20%.
polished: I will be delighted to generate the form of the transaction agreement; however, I have a number of questions regarding the relationship of the delivery point and the use of interruptible transport on the northwest pipeline. Specifically, I would like to know whether the transport is upstream or downstream of the delivery point. If it is downstream, I would like to understand why it is not being contracted for by EWEB. Additionally, I would appreciate clarity on what volume is being sold each day, as you mention the term DCQ and also discuss a 20% tolerance above or below the estimated quantity. Typically, there would be no tolerance with a DCQ transaction. Furthermore, I would like to know if this is envisioned to be a requirements transaction. Is the price the same for volumes in excess of the estimated quantity up to an additional 20%?

original: Jdasovic.nsf the spreadsheet below gives the implicit commodity based on the effective date of four different rates for the same rate schedule (schedule dr). The rate schedule effective august 2000 through september 2000 yields a much larger commodity charge because sdg&e customers will receive a lump sum reimbursement from sdg&e over those two months. Sdg&e customers will expect lower electric bills. Assuming that the lump sum reimbursement is not included in the implicit energy component, the average for june 2000 through january 2001 is 6.2 cts and the implicit commodity average from february 2001 through december 2001 is 7.3 cts. The average implicit commodity from june 2000 through december 2001 is 6.9 cts for deliveries starting september 1, 2000, the average would still be 6.9 cts.
polished: The spreadsheet below presents the implicit commodity cost based on the effective date of four different rates for the same rate schedule, which is effective from August 2000 to September 2000. This rate schedule yields a significantly larger commodity charge because SDG&E customers will receive a lump sum reimbursement from SDG&E over those two months. SDG&E customers will expect lower electric bills. Assuming the lump sum reimbursement is not included in the implicit energy component, the average for June 2000 through January 2001 is 6.2 cents and the implicit commodity average from February 2001 through December 2001 is 7.3 cents. The average implicit commodity from June 2000 through December 2001 is 6.9 cents for deliveries starting September 1, 2000, the average would still be 6.9 cents.

polished:
Re  Commodity Futures Modernization Act

Dear Martin,

I am following up on my earlier email regarding the U.S. changes to the Commodity Futures Modernization Act. As previously mentioned, these updates were forwarded to Mark Evans for distribution. Please find attached the relevant documents for your reference.

Enron North America Corporation
1400 Smith Street, EB 3801A
Houston, Texas 77002
Phone  713-853-5620
Fax  713-646-3490
Email  sara.shackleton@enron.com

Forwarded by Sara Shackleton, Houston, on March 27, 2001, at 10 27 am.

Original Email  March 27, 2001, 09 05 am

To  Martin Rosell
CC

Martin, I hope this email finds you well. In response to your inquiry, I regret to inform you that there is no internal memo available. However, we do possess copies of external law firm memoranda that

original: Tdonoho (non-privileged).pst this has been a tough couple of weeks. I hope that these daily communications on new developments are helping you understand what's happening with our company. Here's a rundown of events from last week: we executed a commitment letter with jpmorgan and salomon smith barney that will provide us with additional secured credit lines worth $1 billion. Our northern natural gas company and transwestern pipeline company will support these assets. We now have received a total of $4 billion in credit lines, which we will use to pay off short-term commercial debt and maintain liquidity. Our board of directors elected a new member to the board - william powers, jr., the dean of the university of texas school of law in austin, texas.
polished: This has been a challenging couple of weeks. I hope that these daily updates on recent developments are helping you stay informed about what's happening at our company. Here's a summary of the key events from last week  we signed a commitment letter with JPMorgan and Salomon Smith Barney, securing $1 billion in additional credit lines. Our Northern Natural Gas Company and Transwestern Pipeline Company will support these assets. We have now received a total of $4 billion in credit lines, which we will use to pay off short-term commercial debt and maintain liquidity. Our board of directors elected a new member to the board - William Powers, Jr., the Dean of the University of Texas School of Law in Austin, Texas.

original: Skean.nsf i am attaching the ferc order and staff recommendations. The order provides for $69 million in "potential" refunds (either pay up or provide cost justification). Enron was not named as one of the 13 overcharging parties, but pge was ($3.18 million). It's not over yet, though. The order deals only with jan 01 and promises further orders regarding dec 00 and benchmark prices through april 01. The prices used to determine refunds were fairly high ($273/mwh based on gas prices, emissions costs and an assumed heat rate of over 16000). With respect to sales to california, we have concluded at least one short term sale and have talked with cal dept of water resources about longer term deals, but we were still struggling with credit issues, last i heard.
polished: I am pleased to attach the final order and staff recommendations. The order provides for $69 million in potential refunds, either paying up or providing cost justification. Enron was not named as one of the 13 overcharging parties, but PGE was $3.18 million. It's not over yet, though. The order deals only with January 1 and promises further orders regarding December 00 and benchmark prices through April 01. The prices used to determine refunds were fairly high, $273/mwh based on gas prices, emissions costs, and an assumed heat rate of over 16,000. With regards to sales to California, we have concluded at least one short-term sale and have spoken with the California Department of Water Resources about longer-term deals, but we were still struggling with credit issues, last I heard.

original: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, have nothing negative to say about this game as it's exceeded my expectations and will probably exeed yours too. Fluid movement, bug/crash free, lots of story/content to put you through, options for each and every day such as multiple practices, events (sponsorships) and even games. This review is purely based on playing mycareer, and so far it's 10/10. Facescan worked really well for me (used it two times, first one made me have a downsyndrome forehead though..). Keep in mind, using the mynba2k17 app will allow for you to facescan for free and allow you to earn daily vc. #sellout
polished: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely astonishing, I have nothing but glowing praise for this game, as it has exceeded my expectations and will likely exceed yours too. The fluid movement and bug-free experience have been a highlight, with a plethora of storylines and content to keep you engaged, including multiple practices, events, and even games. My review is based on my personal experience, and I'm thrilled to report that I've had a seamless experience with no major issues. Facescan worked exceptionally well for me, allowing me to earn daily VC. Keep in mind that using the My NBA 2K17 app will enable you to facescan for free and grant you the opportunity to earn daily VC. Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with my experience and would highly recommend this game to anyone.

original: Magic fans beware... Wizards is afraid to make a decent digital game. At its core magic the gathering is a social game. A game to enjoy with your friends (or frenemies) laughing, talking smack, and dropping game winning bombs. Wizards of the coast seems to have forgotten this. If you choose to play with friends you cant earn gold, and gold is important. Gold is so important that they have implemented a daily cap, understandable considering gold unlocks everything in game. But get ready for a long and boring 1v1 grind against the computer or random oponents, whom you can't even speak to. If you choose to play for free, it will take you roughly 4 hours a day for upwards of a month, by yourself, to unlock the cards.
polished: Be warned, magic fans! The wizarding world of digital gaming is a social experience designed for you to enjoy with friends, whether they be friends or frenemies, sharing laughter, witty banter, and competitive gameplay. At its core, the gathering is a game that values community and connection. However, it seems that the wizards of the coast have forgotten this. If you choose to play with friends, you can earn gold, and gold is crucial. Gold is so vital that it's capped daily, considering it unlocks all aspects of the game. But be prepared for a lengthy and potentially monotonous grind against the AI or random opponents, whom you can't even communicate with. If you opt to play for free, it will take you approximately 4 hours a day for upwards of a month, solo, to unlock the cards and unlock the full potential of the game.

original: Being the 3rd installment in the trilogy i'll get the bad stuff out of the way first. I quite hate pre-quals as it's technically going backwards in a story and not forwards (this is an issue for every pre-qual). Granted it offers more storywise. The combat feels sloppy and doesn't feel as sharp as arkham city managed to make it. As of writing this recommendation (26/10/2013) there is a game breaking bug that stops a side mission from ever being completed (main story not effected). Some gadgets are put at a rediculous hotkey that makes your hand have to travel the whole keyboard to get to it. It might sound like nothing, but while in combat it could potentially break your combo.
polished: As I delve into the third installment of the trilogy, I will address the unpleasant aspects first. I strongly dislike pre-qualifiers, as they often hinder the narrative's forward momentum, rather than propelling it forward (this is a common issue in pre-quals). While they may provide additional story context, the combat mechanics feel clumsy and lack the finesse of Arkham City's more refined approach. As of the time of writing this recommendation (October 26, 2013), a game-breaking bug persists, which prevents a key side mission from ever being completed (the main story remains unaffected). Some gadgets are inconveniently mapped to a hotkey, requiring an arduous journey across the keyboard to access them. Although it may seem minor, this issue can potentially disrupt combat and even break your combo.

original: They basically fixed shadow warrior (2013) i.e. The bossfights are awesome, weapons feel very nice (maybe not as good as d44m's ones, but still solid), enemies aren't too spongy (if you're not too much of a retard with handling elemental and upgrade stuff).
