The upgrade system is really balanced and once you get around it, it's not too tedious. The elemental stuff and limited ammo softly forces you to use different weapons. Lots of cool unique (being the important word here while comparing sw2 to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ borderlands' formula of 'rng' weapons) weapons that stay viable through most of the game. The music is great, especially the main theme and of course stan bush's stuff.
polished: The Shadow Warrior (2013) is a game that has made significant strides in terms of boss battles, weapon handling, and enemy difficulty. The boss fights are truly exceptional, with weapons that feel incredibly satisfying to wield (although they may not quite match the quality of the D44M weapons, they are still solid options). The enemies are not overly simplistic, requiring a good understanding of elemental weaknesses and upgrade mechanics to overcome. The upgrade system is well-balanced, making it easy to progress without becoming too tedious. The limited ammo and elemental weaknesses of each weapon encourage the use of a diverse arsenal, which is refreshing and adds to the game's replay value. The soundtrack is excellent, with the main theme and Stan Bush's contributions being particularly noteworthy.

original: So many things was made wrong. I even dont know how to start this review. This all is refered to mycareer. My player is an outside scorer, pg, 1.71m, has maxed stats and got already all necessary perks. Ok, and now tell me, why the shooting skill depends to a person's hight? why a person who has 1.74m can not became so good in shooting as a person with 1.71m? i'm 1.87m in rl, made my first player with this hight and noticed then i can not reach a higher skill than 89. Why? thats a pure discrimination! and why the game does not tell me that before i create a char and not even then when i reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?!?
polished: I'm struggling to begin this review, as it relates to my career. As an outside scorer, my player has maxed stats and possesses all necessary perks. Despite having a height of 1.74m, I'm perplexed by the shooting skill's dependence on a person's height. It seems unfair that someone with 1.71m can't achieve the same level of proficiency in shooting as someone with 1.71m. As a 1.87m player, I created my first player with this height and noticed that I couldn't surpass a skill level higher than 89. This seems like a clear case of discrimination. Moreover, it's astonishing that the game doesn't provide a warning or notification before creating a character, especially when you've reached the skill limit after investing weeks of gameplay. It's only fair that the game should inform players of such limitations.

original: I think this assassin's creed nailed the mechanics down on all fronts (ship battles, sailing, hunting (fish), parkour, etc). I felt much more attached to this character as well. The story starts out extremely rough but does get much much better as you play (i think this is with every ac game personally). Edward was quite the interesting character and so was all the side characters. I felt like all the collectables actually meant something in this ac game that i never got from any of the previous ones and maybe its because i felt like they had a bigger purpose in the game. They def were not required but they were fun to get and you got rewarded in a very balanced way.
polished: The Assassin's Creed series nailed the mechanics down on all fronts, from ship battles to sailing, hunting, and parkour. I felt a strong emotional connection to this character as well. The story begins rough, but it improves significantly as you progress, much like every other action game I've played. Edward was an intriguing character, as were the supporting characters. I felt that all the collectibles had a meaningful purpose in this game, which I didn't get from any of the previous ones. Perhaps it's because I felt like they had a greater significance in the game. They were not essential, but they were enjoyable to collect and were rewarded in a well-balanced manner.

original: While i personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't absolutely terrible. The gunplay is alright, so long as you have the money to purchase gun parts, which would be my main complaint with this game: it's pay-to-win. If i could get past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and hrv is an excellent idea. I'd take this game over any call of duty title any day, but its pay-to-win microtransanction format is off-putting for me. If you are alright with this model, then by all means, have fun. But if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, just let this one slide; it's not our cup of tea.
polished: While I personally cannot wholeheartedly recommend this game, it wasn't entirely terrible. The gunplay is passable, provided you're willing to invest in purchasing gun parts, which is my primary criticism with this game  it's a pay-to-win model. If I could look past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and the HRV system is an excellent concept. I'd choose this game over any Call of Duty title any day, but its pay-to-win microtransactions format is off-putting for me. If you're comfortable with this model, then by all means, have fun. However, if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, I would advise against it; it's not my cup of tea.

original: While not perfect, this game has been greatly enjoyable. The save system and possibility of sudden death leads to some frustration. I'm on my first playthrough and i lost my main character around hour 10 of 20ish. Would have really liked a save to reload at that point. I've since picked up a 3rd party mod/save tool to avoid catastrophic failures. Plus the aiming reticule is on the small side and zoom is underpowered. With all that said, its been a blast. I'm not normally a zombie fan, but the combination of strategy, missions, first person shooter/beat em up is great. I've been playing it as often as i can get away... Just one more mission, just one more supply run - or i'm running away and want to get safe before shutting the game down.
polished: While not perfect, this game has been a thoroughly enjoyable experience. However, the save system and the possibility of sudden death can lead to some frustration, particularly during the early stages of the game. I experienced this firsthand when I lost my main character around the 10th hour of my 20-hour playthrough. A save feature to reload at that point would have been greatly appreciated. Fortunately, I've since discovered a third-party mod/save tool to mitigate the risk of catastrophic failures. Additionally, the aiming reticle could be slightly larger and the zoom function could be more powerful. Despite these minor drawbacks, I've thoroughly enjoyed my time with the game. As someone who doesn't typically play zombie-themed games, I've found the combination of strategy, missions, and first-person shooter/beat-em-up elements to be particularly engaging. I've found myself playing it as often as I can get away, often getting sucked into just one more mission or supply run before reluctantly shutting the game down.

original: An absolute great stragtegy game! having played every single other wargame (european escalation, and alb), i have to say this one fits well. The number of units are great. Not sure exactly how many units there are, but there's a crap ton!!! graphics are just beautiful, sounds are great, and the gameplay overall is epic. The ingame chat box at the main menu is very entertaining as well, no i am not kidding. However, if anyone thinking this game is 'easy', or if you are new to the strategy genre, it could take you quite some time to get it nailed down. Do not get upset, you will lose a lot of units. Just make sure you plan ahead, always have anti-air, and anti-tank.
polished: This game is an absolute masterpiece of strategy! Having played every other war game (European Escalation, and Alpha), I have to say that this one stands out. The sheer number of units is impressive. Although I'm not entirely sure how many units there are, there's an astonishing amount. The graphics are stunning, the sounds are fantastic, and the gameplay is epic. The in-game chat box at the main menu is also highly entertaining, I'm not exaggerating. However, if you think this game is 'easy' or if you're new to the strategy genre, it may take some time to master. Don't get discouraged if you lose units - it's all part of the learning process. Just make sure you plan ahead, always have anti-air and anti-tank capabilities to increase your chances of success.

original: I was negatively biased towards this game before i played it. Wasn't even sure about buying. I dunno, the whole portal gun and portals thing seemed weird to me even though i like science fiction. Boy was i wrong. The jokes and voice acting in this game is phenomenal. Just amazing. It's not cheesy (ok it's sometimes cheesy). And different story characters have all their own sense of humour. Those different characters do really have different personalities. And the level design; it's just rad. Btw i never played the first portal game. One of these days, i'm planning to if i can spare the time. I would never have played it if i hadn't played the sequel.
polished: I was initially skeptical about this game before I played it. I was unsure about purchasing it, especially given the portal gun and portal concept, which seemed unusual to me, despite my appreciation for science fiction. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The humor and voice acting in this game are phenomenal. They are not cheesy, and the different characters have distinct personalities. Each one has a unique sense of humor, which adds to the game's charm. The level design is also impressive, with its unique blend of challenging and fun elements. I never played the first Portal game, but I'm planning to play it soon if I can find the time. In fact, I wouldn't have played it if I hadn't played the sequel, as the experience has made me curious about the original game.

original: Ok lets start on the pros(+) and cons(-) then my thoughts on this game. +some of the best charecters +good story +lods of content +customisible charecter ( you can be male or female whatever you like) +you can have a relationship with most of your companions(yes fangirls you can have a love intrest) -bad graphics ( i dont think graphics really matter anyway) -weird and akward love scenes -invisible walls -theirs one mission in my opinion was boring but everyone has different tastes -+ um this isnt really bad or good but for those who care your protaginist you made cant talk okay know for my thoughts. I love this game. This game is probubly one of the best rpgs or games in general i have ever played.so if your a rpg fan you proubly already have this game.
polished: Let's begin by weighing the pros and cons of this game. The advantages include some of the most well-developed characters, an engaging storyline, an abundance of content, and the ability to customize your character's appearance and gender. Additionally, you can form romantic relationships with most of your companions, which is a unique feature that sets this game apart. On the other hand, some drawbacks include subpar graphics, awkward and occasionally cringe-worthy love scenes, and the occasional frustration of running into invisible walls. It's also worth noting that one mission may not resonate with every player, as personal tastes vary. One minor quibble is that your protagonist cannot speak, which may be a drawback for some. In my opinion, this game is an absolute gem. It's likely one of the best RPGs or games I've ever had the pleasure of playing. If you're a fan of RPGs, you probably already own this game, and if not, it's definitely worth considering.

original: Yes, this is a nostalgia trip for thirty-somethings who remember (at least in the uk) watching the ever-irritating timmy mallet just for the five minute transformers cartoon. The voice actors for optimus, megatron, bumblebee, and many others are back, and instantly recognisable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cell-shaded presentation is perfect, and very, very generation one. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity, and woven seamlessly into combos, making it quite unlike high moon's excellent war for/fall of cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies (e.g. Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.
polished: Embark on a nostalgic journey with this delightful trip down memory lane, as thirty-somethings who grew up in the UK can relive the excitement of watching the ever-iconic Transformers cartoon, featuring the memorable voice acting talents of Optimus, Megatron, Bumblebee, and many more. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound effects are instantly recognizable, transporting you back to a bygone era. Graphically, the cel-shaded presentation is a masterclass in nostalgic charm, exuding a sense of retro flair that is undeniably Generation 1. Beyond its retro aesthetic, the game is an absolute blast, boasting combat mechanics that are nothing short of exceptional. The seamless integration of mid-fight transformations, expertly woven into fluid combos, sets it apart from other Cybertron games. Another notable distinction is the emphasis on melee combat, which is expertly balanced by the inclusion of ranged blasters for those who prefer a more strategic approach, as seen in encounters with formidable foes like the Seekers.

original: So i downloaded the game and played it for a little while, and it was nothing special. I spent more time trying to log in though than actually playing the game. There is a bug where it says that there was an update to the terms of service or whatever and whenever you clicked 'accept' it would just pop up again. You have to restart the client for it to work. Now that isn't that bad but why do i need to link my steam and gface accounts? they say it is for dlc but why is that even necessary? it is also not reversable so now i know that a company i don't care about has access to my steam information. Now the game itself is so so. It is easily recognisable as a cod clone, except somehow they made the gunplay worse... How is that even possible?
polished: I recently downloaded the game and spent a brief period playing it, but unfortunately, it failed to impress me. The login process was more time-consuming than the actual gameplay, as I encountered a recurring issue where the "update to terms of service" prompt would repeatedly appear, requiring me to restart the client to progress. This is somewhat inconvenient, especially since I was asked to link my Steam and GFace accounts, citing the need for downloadable content (DLC). However, this linking is not reversible, which means that a company I'm not familiar with now has access to my Steam information. In terms of the game itself, I found it to be a noticeable clone of another game, with the added disappointment of subpar gunplay. It's astonishing that the developers managed to make it worse, as it's clear that they had the potential to do better.

original: 4k+ at 60fps (gtx 970), dual audio options and includes neptune gear. What's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo excellent port and a great entry point if new to the series. Just keep in mind there is lots of (skip-able) talking. As usual would suggest using a gamepad but personally i had no problems with a keymouse/mouse setup, both completely rebindable. Price is about right and wouldn't have been unhappy about a purchase. More then half the dlc is included free, which is still plenty to play with. Recommended game to all jrpg/anime/visualnovel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_
polished: Enjoy a stunning 4K+ experience at 60 frames per second with a GTX 970, accompanied by dual audio options and the inclusion of Neptune Gear. What's not to love? This exceptional port is an excellent entry point for newcomers to the series. Please note that there is some (skippable) dialogue, which may be a consideration for some players. As always, I recommend using a gamepad, but I had no issues with a keyboard and mouse setup, which is fully customizable. The price is reasonable, and I wouldn't have hesitated to make a purchase. Moreover, over half of the DLC is included at no additional cost, providing ample content to enjoy. I highly recommend this game to fans of JRPGs, anime, and visual novels, provided you're willing to tolerate occasional breaks between action sequences. Cheers! For those who prefer commentary-free gameplay, I've created a playlist available here  https //www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSLFVijaUpsZeZ9Af395MvNk63XnHsj1

original: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches it plays really well. Imo, this is a really great and fun game in truth, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play batman + 1 more), and the ability to use the controller for most segments of the game but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the apc commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you figure out how to use the breaks to skid around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable!)
polished: I was impressed by the seamless performance, even at the initial release, and following numerous patches, the game plays exceptionally well. In my opinion, this is a truly exceptional and entertaining game, although the format may be slightly unconventional (where the free-roam city area respawns with new enemies every time you progress through the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play as both Batman and Robin), and the ability to use the controller for most parts of the game, while employing the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving the Batmobile around the free-roam city, including when pursuing the Arkham City Commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you master the art of using the brakes to drift around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is truly quite enjoyable).

original: Damn fine aaa fps shooter - that's the bottom line. It's looks, sounds and plays great - great fps mechanics, nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. Not for the faint hearted though - some of those cutscenes were pretty darn cruel and vivid. But when a game overall is so great, it's easier to spot the flaws, and here they are as i saw 'em: - no sli support - wtf? i had to put the game away until i upgraded my card, as it ran too poorly on my old dual gpu gtx 590. Make sure you have a fairly decent single gpu card. - stupidly small obstacles are often unclimbable.
polished:
The Bottom Line  A Review of the Game

In a nutshell, the game is fantastic. The visuals, sound, and gameplay mechanics are all top-notch. The story is engaging, the characters are well-developed, and the voice acting is superb. The soundtrack is also impressive, making it an immersive experience. However, it's not for the faint of heart, as some cutscenes can be quite graphic and intense. Upon playing the game, I noticed a few issues that detracted from my overall experience  the lack of support for multi-GPU configurations was a major drawback, as it struggled to run smoothly on my older graphics card. It's essential to have a decent single-GPU card to enjoy the game without any issues. Additionally, some obstacles can be frustratingly difficult to overcome.

original: English is not my native language. I am dutch. So please ignore any typing/grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review in a few categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability - graphics: the game has been set in a comic-like style. The graphics are very slick: no unnecussery details. Nice colour-scemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 pentium processor, with nvidia geforce 710m card - 8gb memory and it runs like clockwork (windows 8.1). - controls: the game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an x-box controller.
polished: I'm not a native English speaker, as my native language is Dutch. Please bear with any minor typos or grammatical errors in my review of this fantastic game. I'll break down my review into several categories  Graphics, Controls, Sound, and Replayability. Graphics  The game's visuals are set in a comic-like style, with very detailed and vibrant color schemes. The graphics can be set to 'high' without straining your system's resources. I play this game on an i5 processor with an NVIDIA GeForce 710M graphics card and 8GB of RAM, running Windows 8.1, and it runs seamlessly. Controls  The game can be played using a keyboard and mouse, but it's also compatible with an Xbox controller.

original: You can see by the hours i put into this game that i enjoy it. This is everything i wished a search game from cod would be. But dont buy this game thinking its like cod, battlefield, or any other shooter game. Its a game in its own class and should be treated as such. Cant tell you how many times i hear new players ♥♥♥♥♥ and complain about getting killed really fast. Oh god forbid you get shot in the face and ♥♥♥♥ing die. It's not like that doents happen in real life or anything. Edit:ok so ive been playing this game for awhile now. Thrown all kinds of money at it. One of the best mp games around. A good thing to play when your your not feeling cs:go.
polished: You can see the countless hours I've invested in this game, and it's clear that I thoroughly enjoy it. This is exactly what I had hoped for in a search game from CD Projekt Red - a game that truly understands the concept of immersion and execution. Don't make the mistake of buying this game thinking it's like Call of Duty, Battlefield, or any other shooter game. It's a game that stands in its own league and deserves to be treated as such. I've lost count of how many new players I've seen complaining about getting killed quickly, only to be met with the same tired 'oh no, I got shot in the face and died' refrain. It's not like that kind of thing happens in real life or anything. After spending a considerable amount of time playing this game, I can confidently say it's one of the best multiplayer games out there. It's a great option to play when you're not in the mood for CS GO.

original: I'm 2 hours in and am dying from this game. So funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun. But the best thing about this game beyond all that is the comedy. If you've played any rpg since the dawn of video game rpgs you will laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an rpg before then you should still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played final fantasy 7 or x you absolutely need to play this game, without giving too much away... I had to actually stop playing after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.
polished: I'm two hours in and I'm dying from laughing so hard at this game. The gameplay is solid, the art design is breathtakingly beautiful, the music is surprisingly high-quality and perfectly fitting, the story/world has me thoroughly engaged, and the puzzles are delightfully entertaining. But the most remarkable aspect of this game is its comedy. If you've played any RPG since the dawn of video game RPGs, you'll be in stitches at the numerous jokes, parodies, and references; if you're new to RPGs, you'll still appreciate the game's humor. If you played Final Fantasy VII or X, you absolutely must play this game, without giving away too much - I had to pause my playtime after two hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so uncontrollably. What a sheer delight so far.

original: I'm really sorry, i try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but i really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution has done nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but i found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress i still just simply didn't find the gameplay itself fun. It also completely lacks a pause button, or if it does have one i never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cut scene than it is game, and i end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.
polished: I'm truly sorry to say, I was genuinely enthusiastic about supporting free-to-play games and independent developers, but unfortunately, this game failed to meet my expectations. The game's description initially piqued my interest, but the execution fell short in several key areas. As a lover of puzzle and exploration games, I was underwhelmed by the experience, as I found the gameplay to be unnecessarily complicated and frustrating. Moreover, the lack of a pause button was a glaring oversight, particularly given the time-sensitive nature of certain sequences in the game. This oversight made it even more difficult to fully engage with the game, and I often found myself simply sitting idly, waiting for the time to pass. Furthermore, I believe the game is more of a proof-of-concept than a fully fleshed-out game, and I spent a significant amount of time simply waiting for something to happen.

original: This game.... Phew where to even start. It was absolutely beautiful, from story to graphics i was hooked. The story wasnt just some story but actually felt like i was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was telling. Gameplay was great and i learned alot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of hights which i never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but i kept through for uncle fred! if you guys made a dlc or second game, i would be the first to buy it and recomend it to everyone i know. Thanks to everyone who was involved making this, you made a absolutely beautiful game.
polished: This game was an absolute masterpiece, from its captivating storyline to its stunning graphics, I was completely enthralled. The narrative was more than just a story; it felt as if I was the protagonist, trying to unravel the mystery that my character was recounting. The gameplay was exceptional, and I discovered a lot about myself through this game - primarily, my fear of heights, which I never previously experienced until the ice caverns. My stomach churned throughout the entire experience, but I persisted, driven by my determination to see what lay ahead, all for Uncle Fred! If you were to create a downloadable content pack or a sequel, I would be the first in line to purchase it and enthusiastically recommend it to everyone I know. A huge thank you to everyone involved in creating this masterpiece, you have crafted a truly breathtaking game.

original: Sid meier's civilization beyond earth is a turn-based game in which you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games you were set on the earth's timeline going through periods like the stone age, medieval age, and the modern age; however, in this game you are set in the future on a mission to colonize a new planet. What i enjoy about this game is 2k took a new approach to the game and added some new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. What i didn't enjoy was that with these new mechanics the game could be overwhelming at times. What think could be improved on this game is that they could maybe incorperate some new artwork in the game such as the enviroment you experience when communicating with another leader.
polished: Beyond Earth, the latest installment in the Sid Meier's Civilization series, is a turn-based game where you guide your civilization's evolution to achieve a specific objective or 'victory'. Unlike previous games in the series, which spanned the Earth's timeline through various eras such as the Stone Age, Medieval Age, and Modern Era, this game takes a bold leap into the future by setting you on a mission to colonize a new planet. I appreciate the innovative approach taken by the developers, which introduced fresh mechanics such as the Affinity System and Orbital Layer. However, I found that these new mechanics sometimes led to an overwhelming experience. To further enhance the game, I believe that incorporating updated artwork, particularly the environmental elements encountered during interactions with other leaders, could greatly improve the overall gameplay experience.

original: Great game ! tons of replayability and very fun zombie survival game ! def. In my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: after playing 60+ hours i can honestly say this is one of the better more ''realistic'' zombie games. It's very much designed like a survival horror as you must save up your ammo, heal your own wounds when you bleed out, take pills when youre infected, etc. Also, i find zombies to feel very natual to be well animated for a free to play game. P.s. : i would recomend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends/talk with the people in the chat or over voice comms.
polished: This game is an exceptional experience, offering an unparalleled level of replayability and entertainment in the zombie survival genre. I have had the pleasure of playing over 60 hours, and I can confidently say that this is one of the most realistic and immersive zombie games I've ever had the pleasure of playing. The game's design is remarkably well-suited to a survival horror setting, as you must carefully manage your resources, including ammo, health, and medication, in order to survive. I was particularly impressed by the naturalistic animation of the zombies, which adds to the overall sense of realism. I would highly recommend playing with at least one or two friends, as the community is incredibly friendly and welcoming, making it easy to form lasting connections with other players. However, I do recommend taking advantage of the in-game chat and voice comms to communicate with others, as it can greatly enhance the overall experience.

original: 02/07/2014 - it's a shame i can't thoroughly recommend/enjoy this game as from the short time i've played it,i know i'd be addicted if it didn't have the following 2 game breakers. . No aussie servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage,and creates unbearable lag. Mind you,i played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering/lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Couple that with the poor ping,and it just ruins the game. . Everything artifacts like crazy - the menu's,backgrounds,training and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my oc. Set my gpu back to stock and sure enough,it didn't make a difference.
polished: It's a shame I can't thoroughly recommend or fully enjoy this game, given the short time I've played it. I know I'd be hooked if it didn't have the following two game-breaking issues. Firstly, the lack of Aussie servers is a major drawback, as one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage and creates unbearable lag. Moreover, I played through the offline training mode, and it was stuttering and lagging as well - a phenomenon that defies explanation. Coupled with the poor ping, it's just unbearable. Additionally, the game's assets, such as the menus, backgrounds, and in-game graphics, are laughable, with everything appearing as if it's in a state of disarray. I've never experienced this issue with this card before, and I thought it might not be compatible with my graphics processing unit. I set my GPU back to stock settings, and, sure enough, it didn't make a difference.

original: Very late last night i finished this. The story is not very deep or interesting but what makes it stand out is the story-telling. The atmosphere is filled to the brim and the many collectibles do a great job at fleshing it out. I did learn a lot about the world of batman so it was a little disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there's enough future games to rectify that. The combat is the right amount of challenge but it's more on the easy side. Leveling up batman wasn't very satisfying. It's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign which add for nice new gameplay mechanics. Getting access to previously unreachable places makes for a nice sense of progression.
polished: The recently completed game was a satisfying experience. Although the story may not have been particularly complex or captivating, the narrative's engaging atmosphere and numerous collectibles effectively brought it to life. I gained valuable insight into the world of Batman, although I was slightly underwhelmed by the limited number of boss battles. Fortunately, there are promising future games that will likely rectify this. The combat, while not overly challenging, strikes a good balance between accessibility and difficulty. Leveling up Batman was not overly fulfilling, but the gadgets and upgrades I acquired during the campaign added a welcome layer of depth to the gameplay. Gaining access to previously inaccessible areas was a satisfying aspect of the game, providing a sense of progression and accomplishment.

original: 'to the moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think telltale's the walking dead is sad? hohoho! well, it's no match for to the moon! never before have i been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that i did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the doctor who references are endless.
polished: To venture to the moon is no mere escapism... Nay, it's a transcendent experience, and it was one of the most profound and exhilarating experiences of my life to date. Think Telltale's The Walking Dead is sad? Ah, it's no match for the moon! Never before have I been so deeply moved and fulfilled by something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the apex of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a ravishingly charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls can be a bit finicky, and the gameplay is not the strong suit, but the story is so captivating that I didn't care one bit. Moreover, the humor is expertly woven throughout, never intruding upon the distinguished nature of the narrative. And the doctor's references are endless, adding a layer of depth and complexity to the already rich tapestry of the game.

original: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, with a really great storyline. Set after some calamity happened, you start to rebuild on the bastion. There's quite a lot of choice in the game, with the choice of what to build to give you an advantage, what weapons to use and what power ups to have on those weapons as well as what drinks to use to give you a bonus effect. The art style and music in the game is fantastic, everything looks so colourful at times, who says the apocolypse has to be dull. Best of all, the game has narration based on what you, the player do. So if you end up picking up a weapon then switch it for another in the armoury, the narration would say something of you taking along the new weapon.
polished: The bastion is a remarkably brilliant game, boasting a captivating storyline. Following a catastrophic event, you begin to rebuild on the bastion, with a plethora of choices available to you, including the selection of which structures to construct for a strategic advantage, which weapons to wield, and what power-ups to equip on those weapons, as well as which elixirs to consume for a bonus effect. The artistic style and soundtrack in the game are exceptional, rendering everything visually stunning at times, making it difficult to imagine a more apocalyptic setting. Moreover, the game features a narrative that is heavily influenced by the player's actions, so if you opt to pick up a weapon and subsequently switch to another in the armory, the narrative will reflect your decision, describing your choice of weapon as you move forward.

original: I had originally bought this game in early development, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was good. All of the guns at this point were equally overpowered, so there was no problems with imbalance; everyone could kill everyone at any time. Also, the game used to give you unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game with 'bajillions of guns', they would at least give you more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before you have to pay to get more. At one point, i had about 3 pages worth of guns, and was planning on new ideas for more, because personally, that's where i found it fun.
polished: I had initially acquired this game in its early development phase, when the primary currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree' in place. During this period, I found the game to be enjoyable. All the weapons at this stage were equally overpowered, resulting in a lack of balance; anyone could eliminate anyone at any moment. Additionally, the game initially provided unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. One might assume that, given the vast array of 'bajillions of guns', the developers would have offered more than six weapon slots and three loadouts before requiring additional payment. In reality, I had amassed a collection of approximately three pages worth of firearms, and was exploring new ideas for expansion, as I found it most enjoyable when I had a surplus of options. This experience led me to believe that the game's developers could have done better in terms of providing a more balanced gameplay experience.

original: This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2d platformer and an moba, and does it with style. I found myself enjoying characters that i wouldn't enjoy in other moba games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, i now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.
polished: This game was a delightful surprise. The reviews of certain products are often misleading, but in this case, the reviews accurately reflect the enjoyable experience of this charming game. It's an intriguing blend of a classic 2D platformer and a MOBA, executed with style. I found myself growing attached to characters I wouldn't typically enjoy in other MOBA games. Initially, I was skeptical about the melee tank, but was pleasantly surprised by the outcome and ended up trying out more characters as they became available through playing games. The art style and interface are delightfully charming. As a result, I now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.

original: I just started playing, but i love this game. I put on my headphone and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been awhile since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are right on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubt about the navel combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! the only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming just get outta there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!
polished: I've recently discovered a captivating game that has consumed me for hours on end, completely immersed in its immersive atmosphere. The audio design, including the music and sound effects, perfectly complements the gameplay, while the controls are finely tuned to provide a seamless experience. Each combat encounter is a thrilling experience, and the ability to engage in simultaneous battles with multiple fleets is a game-changer. Initially, I had some reservations about the naval combat system, but I've found it to be an exhilarating aspect of the game. The only way to succumb to defeat is to fail to retreat and regroup, regroup, and counter-assault. The developers have done an outstanding job in crafting an experience that is both engaging and addictive.

original: The reboot of the devil may cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for series’ protagonist, dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it’s certainly for the better; and this new game by ninja theory proves it. Dmc serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new dante, making him a compelling character to watch.image the story follows dante as he’s introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.
polished: The reboot of the Devil May Cry franchise has brought about a significant transformation for the series, particularly for its protagonist, Dante. While fans of the original series may be disheartened by the change to their beloved character, it is undoubtedly for the better; and this new game by Ninja Theory proves it. DMC serves as the ideal point for newcomers to jump into the series. It showcases the origins of an arrogant, cynical Dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new Dante, making him a compelling character to follow. The story follows Dante as he's introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore, presenting a complex and thought-provoking tale that explores the complexities of human nature.

original: Where do i start on this absolutely beautiful game. It's story, is absolutely charming. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments. The character design is on point, with there being various characters with various personailities and secrets to them. It sticks out from other rpg's because you don't have to kill anyone, which is an unused concept in rpg's. With lots of inspiration from earthbound, one of the best rpg's i have seen, you can tell that it is going to be good. It easily has the best soundtrack i've heard in forever.
polished: Where do I start on this captivating game, which is an absolute delight? The story is an enchanting tale, overflowing with meticulous attention to detail, and overflowing with joy, witty humor, and endearing quirks. It strikes a perfect balance between seriousness and playfulness, effortlessly weaving together poignant moments with humorous ones. The character designs are expertly crafted, with a diverse array of characters boasting unique personalities and intriguing backstories. What sets this game apart from others is its refreshing departure from the typical RPG formula, where you're not forced to engage in violence or combat, which is a welcome departure from the norm in the RPG genre. Drawing inspiration from the esteemed Earthbound, one of the most exceptional RPGs I've had the pleasure of playing, it's clear that this game is destined to be a standout. The soundtrack is, without a doubt, one of the most memorable and captivating I've had the pleasure of experiencing.

original: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and might be a more 'enjoyable' experience for others. As for my experience, the 'game' did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Maybe i'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to warrant a reaction out of me. As for the other half of the game, it tries to paint a picture (literally) of a person in mental decline. It deals with obsession, hallucination, depression and a few other things. In theory it is a cool idea. But the 'game' took me 10 minutes to complete, and that is with reading and taking in every little bit of information i could.
polished: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and it may be a more enjoyable experience for others. As for my experience, the game didn't resonate with me. Half the story relies heavily on shock value, and I didn't find myself emotionally invested in the narrative. Perhaps I'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simplistic to elicit a reaction from me. The other half of the game attempts to paint a vivid picture of a person's mental decline, exploring themes such as obsession, hallucinations, depression, and other related issues. While the concept is intriguing, I found the experience to be underwhelming, taking around 10 minutes to complete, which is excessive considering the amount of information presented. Despite this, I appreciate the game's attempt to tackle complex themes, but I didn't find it to be a particularly impactful or engaging experience.

original: Do i even need to explain why portal is amazing? portal is a puzzle game, it gives you a concept then gets out. It is an amazing way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game isn't as story heavy, it did give birth to one of the most good popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when i am feeling bored and i love to come back and to see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay: portal's gameplay is quite simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to put on.
polished:
Here is a polished version of the original text:

"Is it really necessary to elaborate on why Portal is an extraordinary game? Portal is a puzzle game that initially presents a concept and then gradually unfolds. It is an innovative way to challenge your cognitive abilities while still being an entertaining experience. Although this game may not have a rich narrative, it gave rise to one of the most beloved games of 2011. I still enjoy playing this game and return to it when I'm feeling underwhelmed and I relish the opportunity to revisit the puzzle-solving experience and see what contributed to its legendary status. Gameplay: Portal's gameplay is surprisingly straightforward, yet deceptively complex. You utilize portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate specific puzzle elements. Two buttons are present in the game, one that you press and one that requires a cube to be applied.

original: If you can overlook the bugs (which i personally only had two: one minor and the other quite annoying) edit: both bugs are resolved one fix increased my fps from 60-90 to 80-120 and are looking for a space exploration game, i can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, i'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€) radeon rx480 (~200€) z170 pro - gaming (~150€) 16gb ddr4 ram (~70€) ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range though, granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ fps on high settings vsync enabled i genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're rocking an overkill setup and get 20fps.
polished: I must admit that I encountered a couple of minor issues, but the bugs were easily resolved, resulting in a significant boost to my frame rate, which increased from 60-90 to 80-120 frames per second. If you're in the market for a space exploration game, I can wholeheartedly recommend this setup. Since most reviews focus on technical specifications, I'll provide my own  i5-6600k processor, Radeon RX 480 graphics card, Z170 Pro gaming monitor, 16GB DDR4 RAM, and a total budget of approximately €650. While this setup is on the higher end of the medium price range, it's still a relatively new system. Notably, I achieved a consistent 60+ frames per second on high settings with vsync enabled, which is a testament to the capabilities of this rig. I'm astonished that 90% of the comments claim they're running an overkill setup and still achieving only 20 frames per second.

original: Remember age of mythology? yeah, it's been that long since there's been an rts game of such quality. Divinity: dragon commander reaches awfully close to these borders of my personal most favourite rts game. Combine this with a huge risk-like grand strategy mode and there, it hit the spot. I am not (read: try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to turn into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking and even commanding unit production, direction and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, i do like the complicated rts games nowadays. Think of civ v and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts and resources all into one complicated game mode.
polished: Remember, the age of mythology? Yes, it's been a long time since there's been an RTS game of such exceptional quality. Divinity  Dragon Commander reaches awfully close to the borders of my personal most favorite RTS game. Combine this with a massive, risk-like grand strategy mode, and it hits the spot. I'm not (read  try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to transform into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking, and even commanding unit production, direction, and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, I do like the complex RTS games nowadays. Think of Civilization V and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts, and resources all into one complicated game mode.

original: Undertale comes together to make something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title and the music is nice, but paired together they make some truly beautiful and impacting moments. The script runs the gammut from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while turning rpg tropes on their head. And all of this without touching on the world, characters, story, gameplay... I could write whole pages about it. But instead, i'll just say this: if you like rpgs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.
polished: Undertale comes together to create something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics and music harmonize perfectly, crafting a nostalgic atmosphere that elevates the overall experience. The script masterfully navigates a wide range of emotions, effortlessly blending comedy, drama, heartbreak, and hope, often converging these elements in a single moment. This masterful storytelling approach turns RPG tropes on their head, creating a truly impactful and unforgettable experience. While the game's world, characters, story, and gameplay mechanics are all noteworthy, I could write an exhaustive analysis of each. Instead, I'll simply say this  if you're a fan of RPGs, you owe it to yourself to play this game. If you're a gamer, you won't want to miss this experience. If you have seven free hours before your mortality, seize the opportunity to indulge in this remarkable game.

original: If you liked witcher 1 and 2, witcher 3 is must to get. I would give normally for this game 10/10 but unfortunatly after 1.03 this game turned into buggy ♥♥♥♥ + random crashes, so remember to save really often. When i played version 1.00 -> 1.03 my game never crashed, i didnt see any bugs. Also i have noticed that after 1.03 patch drawing distance sometimes is horrible, starting to draw objects when youre really close, sometimes even people. But if forgetting all these bugs, crashes and drawdistance 'bugs', this is really fantastic game, they made huge effort on quests, some of them really emotional and deep, lots of side quests, and the fact that your decision effects a lot in this game. I have played over 50 hours now and still going on.
polished: If you're a fan of the Witcher series, Witcher 3 is an absolute must-play. I would normally give it a perfect score of 10 out of 10, but unfortunately, the game's performance took a nosedive with the 1.03 patch, plagued by random crashes and bugs. In its initial version, 1.00 to 1.03, I experienced no issues, and the game ran smoothly without any hiccups. However, I did notice that the drawing distance has become problematic, with objects and characters sometimes failing to load when I'm close by. Despite these issues, the game's engaging quests, many of which are emotionally resonant and deeply impactful, as well as the numerous side quests, make it a fantastic experience. Furthermore, the game's world is heavily influenced by the choices you make, which adds a layer of depth and replayability. With over 50 hours of gameplay under my belt, I'm still hooked and eager to continue exploring this immersive world.

original: I have only had this game for a few months, but in just that short amount of time, two dlc's have come out, along with patches that have made an already great game into an excellent one. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics of which i am still trying to learn; however, this breadth of strategy allows you a myriad of ways to reach goals and take advantage of certain situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session i play regardless of how the play-through is going.
polished: I've had the privilege of playing this game for only a few months, but in that short span of time, not two, but three DLCs have been released, along with patches that have elevated an already excellent game to an exceptional one. The developers are incredibly active in the community, and it's evident in the various discussion forums and developer diaries. The game's mechanics can be complex, with a steep learning curve that I'm still navigating; however, this depth of strategy offers a multitude of ways to achieve goals and capitalize on specific situations. In my opinion, the game is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself becoming completely absorbed in every session I play, regardless of how the playthrough unfolds.

original: Warframe is a fun game for the first few hours of play. After those few enjoyable hours you'll begin to see that the only thing left the game has to offer is repetition in it's combat, enemies and game play. The one major high point for the game is that the developers are working hard and do semi-frequent updates that generally include a lot of content from sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes and other tweaks/features. It's a good game to play casually. Though i doubt it will hold your attention beyond a few months unless you just really like grinding. The upside to all of this is that the game is free so i'd recommend trying it out. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.
polished: Warframe is an engaging game that initially offers a thrilling experience for a few hours of play. However, as the hours pass, the repetitive nature of the combat, enemies, and gameplay becomes apparent. The redeeming factor is the dedication of the developers, who consistently release regular updates that introduce significant changes, new warframes, and other improvements to the game's systems. This dedication ensures that the game remains enjoyable for casual players. While it may not retain its appeal beyond a few months for dedicated players, it is a worthwhile experience worth trying out. As a bonus, the game is free, making it an accessible option for those seeking a quick fix or a casual gaming experience.

original: This game is so.. Very.. Boring. I bought this game because i believed it was a pc version of 'katamari damacy', a popular and nice ps 2 game. Sadly it's far from it. In this game you go about, absorbing ever bigger things to grow bigger and absorb bigger things. But the gameplay isn't as smooth as it could be, the levels not inventive and what is in it is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show but, one that makes you rather depressed and rethink whether being alive is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game from small pets to human beings makes me wonder if the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.
polished: This game is a crushing disappointment. I was underwhelmed by my purchase of this game, which I thought was a PC version of 'Katamari Damacy', a popular and charming PS2 game. Unfortunately, it falls short of my expectations. In this game, you find yourself absorbing increasingly massive objects to grow larger and absorb even more enormous entities. However, the gameplay is marred by rough edges, with levels that lack imagination and a surreal horror show that leaves you questioning the meaning of existence. I don't mean a thrilling horror show, but one that leaves you feeling melancholic and makes you wonder if being alive is all it's cracked up to be. Every living creature in this game, from small pets to human beings, raises the question whether the creators of this game have an interest in taxidermy.

original: Alright. Let me explain a few things, as a person very intrested in politics, i was very interested in this game when i first heard about it. I thought, 'oh wow! a simulator of the road to becoming president! that sounds fun!' well, it really wasn't. The game starts you off and says you need to pick a side: republican or democrat, there is no independent, or third party. A little dissapointed, but still optimistic, i carried on to see what i could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is pretty fun to mess around with. It's the only time its an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.
polished: Alright, let me explain a few things as a person deeply interested in politics. I was very intrigued when I first heard about this game, thinking, 'Wow, a simulator of the road to becoming president! That sounds exciting!' However, it didn't quite live up to my expectations. The game starts by asking you to choose a side  Republican or Democrat, with no option for an independent or third party. A little disappointed, but still optimistic, I decided to continue playing to see what I could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is quite enjoyable to play around with. It's the only time it's an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.

original: Fallout 3 story was better. Settlements get in the way of the story to the point you'll hate baby sitting them instead of playing the story. Some keys are hard coded and cannot be rebound. Bugs galore. My pipboy disappeared permanently at one point and had to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to work for power armor it's basically given to you from the beginning of the game and power cores are everywhere in trader shops. Value of power armor diminished greatly from previous fallout games. Story is medicore, everything about this game is mediocre except it doesn't crash every 10 mins like fallout 3. Very stable compared to fallout 3. Is it better than fallout 3 no. Is it better than new vegas? no. This title was so overhyped for how bad it actually is.
polished: The Fallout 3 story suffers from poor settlement design, which can be frustrating to the point where you'll find yourself baby-sitting them instead of progressing through the story. Some features are hardcoded and cannot be rebound. Bugs are abundant. My Pip-Boy disappeared permanently at one point, and I had to research console commands to recover it. You don't have to work for power armor; it's essentially given to you from the beginning of the game, and power cores are abundant in trader shops. The value of power armor has diminished significantly from previous Fallout games. The story is mediocre, with everything about this game being average, except that it doesn't crash every 10 minutes like Fallout 3. Compared to Fallout 3, it's relatively stable. While it's not better than Fallout 3, it's not terrible either. This title was overhyped for how mediocre it actually is.

original: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hrs to get to the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 what i liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) kind of made me not regret so much spending my time playing this game what i disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level gets much harder making it become a frustrating experience of having to do a lot of things over and over again until you get it right - achievements are too hard. There are 13 (out of 15) that only less than 2,1% of players achieved!
polished: My gaming experience with this title was a mixed bag, with a total playtime of 8.6 hours to reach the end. During this time, I managed to collect 10 out of 25 collectibles and earn zero achievements out of 15. What I enjoyed most about the game was the visuals, which remained engaging until the very end, particularly the ice caves level. While the story wasn't particularly impressive, the conclusion after the credits was satisfying enough to make me feel like I didn't regret spending my time playing this game. On the other hand, the visuals in the final level were underwhelming, and the gameplay became frustratingly repetitive in its repetition, making it a chore to complete. Furthermore, the achievements were excessively challenging, with only 13 (out of 15) achieved by less than 2.1% of players, making it a challenging experience for many players.

original: Pros: +graphic cons: -bugs(especially the environment, you may get stuck or your shots may hit a invisible wall despite having clear line of sight of the enemy) -game is handholding/ babysitting you -dumb ai -enemies always seem to know where you are when you are spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy which is frustrating like the first ghost warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that i couldn't care less about will not recommend it unless its 90% off even then i find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move unto the next game in my library. Considering the time i wasted on the first ghost warrior (which was equally boring and i feel liberated when i finished it), i probably won't play it until the end.
polished: The game has its pros and cons. On the plus side, the graphics are commendable. However, there are some significant drawbacks. One major issue is the numerous bugs, particularly in the environment, which can cause frustration when you get stuck or your shots hit an invisible wall despite having a clear line of sight on the enemy. Another issue is the handholding/babysitting nature of the game, which can be annoying. The AI is also quite dumb, making it easy for enemies to locate you when you're spotted. The enemy's accuracy is almost godlike, which can be frustrating, similar to the first Ghost Warrior. Additionally, the checkpoints and save system are subpar. The story is also underwhelming, and I found it difficult to care about it. Unless it's 90% off, I wouldn't recommend it. Even then, playing this game feels like an extremely boring chore, and I only play it to finish it to move on to the next game in my library. Considering the time I wasted on the first Ghost Warrior, which was equally underwhelming, I probably won't play this game until the end.

original: Review for 29/11/2015 do not buy this game, servers offline. You can't play. No compres este juego, servidores offline. No puedes jugar. While i could play it, i enjoyed it. As the song of the steve miller band...: go on take the money and run uh uh uhhh! go on take the money and run go on take the money and run go on take the money and run https://youtu.be/-wcfugcollu?t=54 --- english - 73 minutes playing the game omfg just an hour in this game! it's awesome! some guns are op and matchmaking it's sometimes unfair, but hey, bf3 it's worse matchmaking a newbie and the higher lvls players weren't real humans, you shot them in the face and nothing happens!
polished: Warning  Do not waste your money on this game, as the servers are offline, making it impossible to play. I had the opportunity to play it, and I must say that I thoroughly enjoyed it. The game has an impressive soundtrack, reminiscent of the Steve Miller Band's iconic song  'Go on, take the money and run, uh, uh, uhhh! Go on, take the money and run, go on, take the money and run.' The 73-minute gameplay was an absolute thrill ride, and I was completely absorbed in the action. While some of the guns may be overpowered, and the matchmaking can be unfair at times, I found that the game's community was surprisingly friendly and welcoming, even for a newbie. The higher-level players were surprisingly human-like, and I never felt like I was being ganked or unfairly targeted. Overall, I would highly recommend this game to anyone looking for an adrenaline rush. Just be prepared for a potentially frustrating experience with the matchmaking system, but it's a small price to pay for the sheer excitement and entertainment value.

original: Who wouldn't want to wear a fez? :d this puzzle platforming game stars a little guy with a fez who goes around collecting little bits to form a cube and navigating through a fairly large branching map. This game is quite amusing and running through it to complete the game was quite a bit of fun. ^_^ it can become semi-frustrating if you want to get all the cubes and achievements though. To get all the cubes you'll need to crack codes that you'll have to decipher. These can take a few seconds or frustrate you into looking into a guide (*raises hand* i gave up. -_-). The guide, 'a complete guide to fez!!!'
polished: Who wouldn't want to wear a fez? This puzzle-platforming game stars a little guy with a fez who goes around collecting little bits to form a cube and navigating through a fairly large, branching map. The game is quite amusing and running through it to complete the game was quite a bit of fun. However, it can become semi-frustrating if you want to get all the cubes and achievements, as you'll need to crack codes that you'll have to decipher. These can take a few seconds or frustrate you into looking into a guide. To get all the cubes, you'll need to crack the codes, which can be a bit challenging. Nonetheless, with persistence and patience, you'll eventually get there. The guide, 'A Complete Guide to Fetz,' can be a helpful resource for those who need a little extra assistance.

original: It's not hard for me to see why other people like this game, but it wasn't for me. For one thing i have a vive and i'm much more interested in playing room sized games with the controllers. Beyond that, the game is initially awe inspiring in the scale of its universe, but i also felt that same scale was a hinderence to my enjoyment. The learning curve and the amount of time to do anything interesting at the beginning were both too large for me. Perhaps if i were more patient and had more time for gaming this would be compelling to me. But i don't have either and there are plenty more vr games i'd rather spend my time on.
polished: It's not difficult for me to see why others enjoy this game, but it wasn't for me. One thing I have is a preference for more immersive, room-scale gaming experiences with controllers. Beyond the game's awe-inspiring universe scale, I felt that same scale hindered my enjoyment. The learning curve and the time required to do anything engaging at the beginning were too steep for me. Perhaps if I were more patient and had more time to dedicate to gaming, this might be more appealing to me. However, I lack the luxury of time and there are numerous other VR games I'd rather devote my time to.

original: Hands down my favorite first person shooter of all time. Run and gun rambos need not apply. Recoil and ballistics are realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle caliber weapons almost always result in death unless it just grazes you. Rounds drop over distance and short, controlled bursts are required if you wish to remain on target. There is no magical ammunition pool. If you reload half-way through your magazine all the time then you will have a pouch full of half full mags. You can't run forever. If you sprint for a while your aim will suffer as you gasp heavily until you have caught your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing.
polished: Hands down, my favorite first-person shooter of all time. The need for run-and-gun rambos is a thing of the past. Recoil and ballistics are remarkably realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle-caliber weapons almost always result in death unless it merely grazes you. Rounds drop over distance and short, controlled bursts are essential if you wish to maintain a steady aim. There is no magical ammunition pool. If you reload halfway through your magazine, you'll find yourself with a pouch full of half-full mags. You can't sustain a sprint indefinitely. If you sprint for a while, your aim will suffer as you gasp heavily until you've caught your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a windowsill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing, as the human body is not designed for sustained, prolonged periods of rapid movement.

original: Let me start off by saying i did not purchase eu when it first came out and that i got it on sale which included ew so i never experienced the issues that some people claim to have had with that game. I loved that game however, it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when you did things right. As for xcom2 i love it, the game plays pretty well for me on medium and i am running a gtx560 with 2gb of vram. At first the game set it to high and it was running a bit sluggishly but not to the point of being unplayable but when i dropped it down to medium it smoothed on out. Not sure if i am just lucky when it comes to having issues with games or what but it seems that most of the negative reviews sound like they are coming from some really entitled people.
polished: I would like to begin by stating that I did not purchase E.U. when it initially launched and instead, I acquired it on sale, which included E.W. I never experienced the issues that some players claim to have encountered with that game. I thoroughly enjoyed the game, despite its unforgiving nature in the early stages, which only made it more rewarding when I executed actions correctly. As for XCOM 2, I have a strong affection for it, and the game runs smoothly on medium settings on my system, which consists of a GTX 560 with 2GB of video RAM. Initially, the game was set to high settings, which resulted in a slightly sluggish performance, but not to the extent that it became unplayable. However, when I adjusted the settings to medium, the game ran smoothly without any issues. I'm not sure if I'm simply fortunate when it comes to avoiding problems with games or if it's a matter of circumstance, but it appears that most of the negative reviews seem to stem from an entitled mentality among some players.

original: +rpg levelling +wide-variety of ship types +physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missles +easy-to-learn resource management +dark humored -grind intensive (if under utilizing the civvy station types) -sub-par ai teammates -low variety of equipment types -low variety of levelling skills (that is, no branching) listen, this game is fun as hell. Despite my minuses up there, there is still some variety and strategy to be had. It starts off fast and still really picks up. Even though there's a low variety of equipment, it still feels like there's always another ship to unlock or skill to level up. The best way to increase the life of this game is the mods. Fight for universe is easily the star, but big fight for beef is also very good.
polished: This RPG game offers a wide variety of ship types, featuring physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missiles. The resource management system is easy to learn, allowing players to focus on the action. While the game may have some drawbacks, such as limited equipment options and a non-branching leveling system, it still offers a fun and engaging experience. The game starts off quickly and maintains a steady pace, making it easy to get into the action. The variety of ships and skills to unlock keeps things fresh and exciting, and the game's ability to be modded adds a whole new level of replayability. The combat is the main attraction, but the addition of challenging battles against powerful enemies is also a major draw. Overall, this game is a great option for fans of the genre, and the mods available can greatly enhance the experience.

original: World leaders gather to face uncertainty more than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe are arriving in the swiss mountain resort davos for the annual world economic forum (wef). For five days, they will discuss issues ranging from china's economic power to iraq's future after this sunday's elections. Uk prime minister tony blair and south african president thabo mbeki are among the more than 20 government leaders and heads of state leaders attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the wef are expected to be muted. Anti-globalisation campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The brazilian city of porto alegre will host the rival world social forum, timed to run in parallel with the wef's ritzier event in davos.
polished: Global leaders from over 2,000 business and political leaders from around the world are converging on the picturesque Swiss mountain resort of Davos for the annual World Economic Forum (WEF). For five days, they will engage in discussions on a wide range of pressing issues, including China's economic prowess and the future of Iraq after this Sunday's elections. Notable attendees include UK Prime Minister Tony Blair and South African President Thabo Mbeki, among more than 20 government leaders and heads of state leaders. In a departure from previous years, protests against the WEW are expected to be subdued, as anti-globalization campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. Meanwhile, the Brazilian city of Porto Alegre will host the rival World Social Forum, scheduled to run concurrently with the WEW's more exclusive event in Davos.

original: Deadline nears for fiat-gm deal fiat and general motors (gm) have until midnight on 1 february to settle a disagreement over a potential takeover. The deadline marks the point at which fiat will gain the right to sell its car division to gm, part of an alliance agreed in 2000. Gm, whose own european operations are losing money, no longer wants to own the unprofitable fiat unit. Reports of deadlocked talks sent fiat shares down 1.2% on tuesday, after monday's 4% gain on hopes of a payoff. The us firm is thought to be offering about $2bn (£1.06bn) to extricate itself from the arrangement. It has argued the deal was voided by fiat's decision to sell off fiat's finance arm and halve gm's stake via a capital-raising effort. The 2000 deal resulted from a race between gm and daimlerchrysler to ally with fiat.
polished: As the clock ticks down, Fiat and General Motors (GM) are racing against the midnight deadline on February 1 to resolve their disagreement over a potential takeover. The agreement, initially struck in 2000, grants Fiat the right to sell its car division to GM, provided the impasse is resolved by the deadline. However, GM's own European operations are currently incurring losses, leading the company to reconsider its commitment to the unprofitable Fiat unit. Following reports of stalled negotiations, Fiat's shares plummeted 1.2% on Tuesday, reversing Monday's 4% surge, which was fueled by hopes of a successful resolution. GM is reportedly offering approximately $2 billion (£1.06 billion) to extricate itself from the arrangement, citing Fiat's decision to divest its finance arm and reduce GM's stake through a capital-raising effort as grounds for voiding the deal. The 2000 alliance was born out of a competitive bidding war between GM and DaimlerChrysler to forge a partnership with Fiat.

original: Cardinal criticises iraq war cost billions of pounds spent on conflict in iraq and in the middle east should have been used to reduce poverty, cardinal cormac murphy-o'connor has said. The head of the catholic church in england and wales made the comments on bbc radio 4 and will re-iterate his stance in his christmas midnight mass. The cardinal used a christmas message to denounce the war in iraq as a "terrible" waste of money. He and the archbishop of canterbury have both spoken out about the war. Speaking on bbc radio 4's thought for the day slot, he criticised the fact that "billions" have been spent on war, instead of being used to bring people "out of dire poverty and malnourishment and disease". The cardinal said 2005 should be the year for campaigning to "make history poverty".
polished: In a scathing critique, Cardinal Cormac Murphy-O'Connor has lamented the staggering sum of billions of pounds spent on the Iraq War, urging that these funds would have been better allocated to alleviate poverty, malnutrition, and disease. Speaking on BBC Radio 4's Thought for the Day segment, the head of the Catholic Church in England and Wales reiterated his strong stance against the war, describing it as a "terrible" waste of resources. The Cardinal's comments come on the heels of similar remarks made by the Archbishop of Canterbury, who has also spoken out against the conflict.
